commit_message:
Add DNS sanity checks to k8s deploy script

Check that k8s DNS is working, and terminate at the beginning if this is
not the case.

Change-Id: I30867671f39dd9d80f46f5a4381adc9d34df7ab7

commit_message:
Improve health probe logging for nova and neutron

1. Log specific compute services failing rabbitMQ socket tests in nova
   health probe
2. Log specific compute services failing Database socket tests in nova
   health probe
3. Make log level configurable for nova and neutron health probes

Change-Id: I5e5d909d598af734596eb1732ae42808c1f6cd12

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-23 16:17:31.000000000', 'message': "WIP: libvirt: Prepare for manual PCIe address management

A number of of our devices are connected to the PCIe bus when using the
Q35 machine type on x86. Prepare for manual management of these
addresses by adding an address attribute to their elements in the
'libvirt.config' module.

Note that addresses configured for PCIe guests won't necessarily match
the actual address assigned to the guest by QEMU and libvirt. This is
discussed in the libvirt documentation [1].

[1] https://libvirt.org/pci-addresses.html

Change-Id: Iaebb277894242bbba5238d67bc9864f3991a5105
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: Prepare for manual PCIe address management

A number of of our devices are connected to the PCIe bus when using the
Q35 machine type on x86. Prepare for manual management of these
addresses by adding an address attribute to their elements in the
'libvirt.config' module.

Note that addresses configured for PCIe guests won't necessarily match
the actual address assigned to the guest by QEMU and libvirt. This is
discussed in the libvirt documentation [1].

[1] https://libvirt.org/pci-addresses.html

Change-Id: Iaebb277894242bbba5238d67bc9864f3991a5105
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-23 16:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: libvirt: Remove handling for older libvirt versions

The 'Guest.delete_configuration' method was handling the absence of the
'virDomainUndefineFlags' libvirt API. However, this was introduced in
libvirt commit b26a9fa9c226447e5f1153fb59eea4b92b848178 ("undefine:
Define the new API") and was released in libvirt v0.9.4, while the
'VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_NVRAM' flag was introduced in libvirt commit
273b6581ca8dae11e6ff40e3d13813fdbb37d41b ("virDomainUndefineFlags: Allow
NVRAM unlinking") and was released in libvirt v1.2.9. We don't need to
handle the absence of either.

Similarly, the 'Guest.get_job_info' method was handling the absence of
the 'virDomainGetJobStats' API. However, this was introduced in libvirt
commit 4dd00f4238df262092550d533496bbf0bc7522a2 ("Introduce
virDomainGetJobStats API") from v1.0.3. We don't need to handle this
being missing either.

WIP cos tests.

Change-Id: I30a667ee3d489d148812980030b078c2b32f40bb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: Remove handling for older libvirt versions

The 'Guest.delete_configuration' method was handling the absence of the
'virDomainUndefineFlags' libvirt API. However, this was introduced in
libvirt commit b26a9fa9c226447e5f1153fb59eea4b92b848178 ("undefine:
Define the new API") and was released in libvirt v0.9.4, while the
'VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_NVRAM' flag was introduced in libvirt commit
273b6581ca8dae11e6ff40e3d13813fdbb37d41b ("virDomainUndefineFlags: Allow
NVRAM unlinking") and was released in libvirt v1.2.9. We don't need to
handle the absence of either.

Similarly, the 'Guest.get_job_info' method was handling the absence of
the 'virDomainGetJobStats' API. However, this was introduced in libvirt
commit 4dd00f4238df262092550d533496bbf0bc7522a2 ("Introduce
virDomainGetJobStats API") from v1.0.3. We don't need to handle this
being missing either.

WIP cos tests.

Change-Id: I30a667ee3d489d148812980030b078c2b32f40bb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 18:41:26.000000000', 'message': 'Create random character devices so systemd does not crash

Systemd, depending on the version and the configuration,
can attempt to open urandom when a ramdisk boots, before
the udevd is launched to handle the devices. In particular
in FIPS mode, this can result in the ramdisk crashing.

In order to handle this, we pre-create the chracter device
files which can be statically used in the early start sequence
to allow the agent to boot and deploy.

Change-Id: I587e66a0d6b652c4aeca6fc211602d999d4641e8
(cherry picked from commit 94171f104c441f8aea4f8cfadddbb6f0964b09a4)
(cherry picked from commit 7bf70725a6376f0967ca93dba3c6cdab479c59b6)
'}]
commit_message:
Create random character devices so systemd does not crash

Systemd, depending on the version and the configuration,
can attempt to open urandom when a ramdisk boots, before
the udevd is launched to handle the devices. In particular
in FIPS mode, this can result in the ramdisk crashing.

In order to handle this, we pre-create the chracter device
files which can be statically used in the early start sequence
to allow the agent to boot and deploy.

Change-Id: I587e66a0d6b652c4aeca6fc211602d999d4641e8
(cherry picked from commit 94171f104c441f8aea4f8cfadddbb6f0964b09a4)
(cherry picked from commit 7bf70725a6376f0967ca93dba3c6cdab479c59b6)

commit_message:
Fix tox to ignore_basepython_conflict

Tox includes a couple of enhancements:

- [1] previously mishandled the basepython directive.
- previously ignored PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE [2]

So we can remove the workarounds.

See ML thread [3] for some details

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/477
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/thread.html#132075

Change-Id: Ibd8b77bb10c5a739fea11a02e959b66c5e81f221
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2022-02-21 16:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-designateclient for Yoga

This is a release for python-designateclient to get any merged but unreleased
changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 25th.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.4.0..485cbdd
52e9ef4 Add profiling support to designateclient
2e26a07 Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime
87e9b33 Add basic osc unit tests
15a0070 Add Designate hacking checks to the client
94e7e97 Remove edit-managed from unsupported commands
fa615f7 Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
a3c21fd Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version
d6c78e2 Remove H402 hacking as it is deprecated
f02f009 Stop to use the __future__ module.
5fbc5b1 Clarify that name or ID can be used on TLDs
6a8f10a setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I4bb03dcc41c3a9deb9a59843a7cc58731528084a
'}]
commit_message:
Release final python-designateclient for Yoga

This is a release for python-designateclient to get any merged but unreleased
changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 25th.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.4.0..485cbdd
52e9ef4 Add profiling support to designateclient
2e26a07 Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime
87e9b33 Add basic osc unit tests
15a0070 Add Designate hacking checks to the client
94e7e97 Remove edit-managed from unsupported commands
fa615f7 Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
a3c21fd Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version
d6c78e2 Remove H402 hacking as it is deprecated
f02f009 Stop to use the __future__ module.
5fbc5b1 Clarify that name or ID can be used on TLDs
6a8f10a setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I4bb03dcc41c3a9deb9a59843a7cc58731528084a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-22 16:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'Import VMT oversight information from governance

The OpenStack TC has decided to stop using its "governance tags"
mechanism for recording specific details about project deliverables.
We previously relied on a vulnerability:managed tag to indicate the
deliverables overseen by the VMT, as well as documenting
expectations for the teams responsible for them.

commit_message:
Import VMT oversight information from governance

The OpenStack TC has decided to stop using its "governance tags"
mechanism for recording specific details about project deliverables.
We previously relied on a vulnerability:managed tag to indicate the
deliverables overseen by the VMT, as well as documenting
expectations for the teams responsible for them.

Tags, being deliverable-specific rather than repository-specific,
were never a great fit for us. When bringing this information into
our own documentation, it's now reworked as a list of specific Git
repositories for simplicity and granularity. The expectations have
also been edited and shortened in order to accommodate this change,
but are still effectively the same as they were in governance.

Change-Id: Ie3c0cc38fc071716420c12b3f6de4a320428bd04

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-16 19:49:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the need for project_id from API endpoints

Inclusion of a project_id in API URLs is now optional, and no longer
required. Removing the project_id requirement facilitates supporting
Secure RBAC's notion of system scope, in which an API method is not
associated with a specific project.

The API v3 routing is enhanced to provide duplicate routes for API
methods that traditionally required a project_id in the URL:
- The existing route for which a project_id is in the URL
- A new route for when the URL does not include a project_id

To test both routes and ensure there are no regresssions, the "API
samples" functional tests include a project_id in the URLs, and the
rest of the functional tests do not include the project_id. This is
handled by changing the 'noauth' WSGI middleware to no longer add the
project_id, and adding a new 'noauth_include_project_id' middleware
filter that implements the legacy behavior.

A new microversion V3.67 is introduced, but it only serves to inform
clients whether the project_id is optional or required. When an API
node supports mv 3.67, the project_id is optional in all API requests,
even when the request specifies a earlier microversion. See the spec
Ia44f199243be8f862520d7923007e7182b32f67d for more details on this
behavior.

Note: Much of the groundwork for this is based on manila's patch
I5127e150e8a71e621890f30dba6720b3932cf583.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Implements: blueprint project-id-optional-in-urls
Change-Id: I3729cbe1902ab4dc335451d13ed921ec236fb8fd

commit_message:
Remove the need for project_id from API endpoints

Inclusion of a project_id in API URLs is now optional, and no longer
required. Removing the project_id requirement facilitates supporting
Secure RBAC's notion of system scope, in which an API method is not
associated with a specific project.

The API v3 routing is enhanced to provide duplicate routes for API
methods that traditionally required a project_id in the URL:
- The existing route for which a project_id is in the URL
- A new route for when the URL does not include a project_id

To test both routes and ensure there are no regresssions, the "API
samples" functional tests include a project_id in the URLs, and the
rest of the functional tests do not include the project_id. This is
handled by changing the 'noauth' WSGI middleware to no longer add the
project_id, and adding a new 'noauth_include_project_id' middleware
filter that implements the legacy behavior.

A new microversion V3.67 is introduced, but it only serves to inform
clients whether the project_id is optional or required. When an API
node supports mv 3.67, the project_id is optional in all API requests,
even when the request specifies a earlier microversion. See the spec
Ia44f199243be8f862520d7923007e7182b32f67d for more details on this
behavior.

Note: Much of the groundwork for this is based on manila's patch
I5127e150e8a71e621890f30dba6720b3932cf583.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Implements: blueprint project-id-optional-in-urls
Change-Id: I3729cbe1902ab4dc335451d13ed921ec236fb8fd

commit_message:
Fix dependencies and PEP 8 new comments.

Updated new version of 'pyflakes' dependency
in 'test-requirements.txt' file.

The following new flake8 comments were fixed:

W503: line break before binary operator
F523: '...'.format(...) has unused arguments at position(s)
H214: Use assertIn/NotIn(A, B) rather than assertTrue/False(A in/not in B)
H904: String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code

The following new flake8 comments were ignored:

W504: line break after binary operator

Change-Id: I387f17e37c326600a4aebbf8ca915fdb3aed6314

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-12 14:25:15.000000000', 'message': "Rollback problematic port bindings on source host only

Nova needs to revert created port bindings on destination host using
Neutron API after failed live migrations. Currently Nova can do this
on source compute node if shared storage is used or on destination
compute node if shared storage is not used.

This change was introduced for the following reasons:

- Port bindings are not related to storage setup, so storage setup
  should not affect the way we treat port bindings.
- During RCA for one of deployments where bug #1849802 was reproduced
  we have found that Nova haven't removed incorrect port bindings for
  destination compute because of RPC-related problems.
- Log messages generated when Nova Compute fails to remove port
  bindings would be generated on source node only.

This patch also helps to avoid supporting similar code in
two different places.

Related-bug: #1849802
Change-Id: I0dbf40e69b589da1e16979fa543a2ce4bb04d11f

commit_message:
Rollback problematic port bindings on source host only

Nova needs to revert created port bindings on destination host using
Neutron API after failed live migrations. Currently Nova can do this
on source compute node if shared storage is used or on destination
compute node if shared storage is not used.

This change was introduced for the following reasons:

- Port bindings are not related to storage setup, so storage setup
  should not affect the way we treat port bindings.
- During RCA for one of deployments where bug #1849802 was reproduced
  we have found that Nova haven't removed incorrect port bindings for
  destination compute because of RPC-related problems.
- Log messages generated when Nova Compute fails to remove port
  bindings would be generated on source node only.

This patch also helps to avoid supporting similar code in
two different places.

Related-bug: #1849802
Change-Id: I0dbf40e69b589da1e16979fa543a2ce4bb04d11f

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-22 18:20:57.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Handle RouterNotFound exception in set_gateway_mtu

When handling multiple router update/delete petitions, if they are
executed at the same time, there is a chance that the set_gateweay_mtu
tries to update a no-longer-existing router, triggering a
RouterNotFound error from the _get_router_ports function. Now, if there
is not a router, the _get_router_ports function will return an empty
list instead of raising the error.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic54214ca4965274cd58c1d3a278d8f3ffcda0a64
'}, {'created': '2022-02-23 09:49:40.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Handle RouterNotFound exception in set_gateway_mtu

When handling multiple router update/delete petitions, if they are
executed at the same time, there is a chance that the set_gateway_mtu
tries to update a no-longer-existing router, triggering a
RouterNotFound error from the _get_router_ports function. Now, if there
is not a router, the _get_router_ports function will return an empty
list instead of raising the error.

commit_message:
[OVN] Handle RouterNotFound exception in set_gateway_mtu

When handling multiple router update/delete petitions, if they are
executed at the same time, there is a chance that the set_gateway_mtu
tries to update a no-longer-existing router, triggering a
RouterNotFound error from the _get_router_ports function. Now, if there
is not a router, the _get_router_ports function will return an empty
list instead of raising the error.

Closes-Bug: #1961967
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic54214ca4965274cd58c1d3a278d8f3ffcda0a64

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-08 16:09:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix clean-up process for aborted queued live migrations

Bug #1949808 describes one of the problems affecting aborted queued
live migrations: VM's status is not reverted back to ACTIVE and
VM is left in MIGRATING state.

However that's not the single problem with aborted queued live
migrations: some changes (port bindings on destination host,
resource allocations and possibly instance's pci_requests)
are introduced by Nova control plane before live migration
actually started by source compute host. Those left-overs
should also be removed.

Multiple ways to achieve this were considered:

1. There is existing _rollback_live_migration function used to
   revert changes introduced during pre_live_migration and
   live_migration phases. Unfortunately this function contains
   a lot of extra calls related to BDMs, driver and even
   RPC calls for destination hypervisor which are not needed
   for queued live migrations: Nova Compute didn't took any
   steps for such migrations and sofisticated rollback is not
   needed.
2. We can run few extra steps and finish pre_live_migration
   tasks and then try to revert everything. Hovewer it looks
   irrational and error-prone to take extra steps to set up
   things and intentionally destroy them shortly after.

As a result, it looks rational to simply copy proper actions from
_rollback_live_migration function to live_migration_abort
function.

Closes-bug: #1949808
Change-Id: Iea193ce8ae7a076051c6d2672ae62852f71e68f5
"}, {'created': '2022-02-09 13:30:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix clean-up process for aborted queued live migrations

Bug #1949808 describes one of the problems affecting aborted queued
live migrations: VM's status is not reverted back to ACTIVE and
VM is left in MIGRATING state.

However that's not the single problem with aborted queued live
migrations: some changes (port bindings on destination host,
resource allocations and possibly instance's pci_requests)
are introduced by Nova control plane before live migration
actually started by source compute host. Those left-overs
should also be removed.

Multiple ways to achieve this were considered:

1. There is existing _rollback_live_migration function used to
   revert changes introduced during pre_live_migration and
   live_migration phases. Unfortunately this function contains
   a lot of extra calls related to BDMs, driver and even
   RPC calls for destination hypervisor which are not needed
   for queued live migrations: Nova Compute didn't took any
   steps for such migrations and sofisticated rollback is not
   needed.
2. We can run few extra steps and finish pre_live_migration
   tasks and then try to revert everything. Hovewer it looks
   irrational and error-prone to take extra steps to set up
   things and intentionally destroy them shortly after.

As a result, it looks rational to simply copy proper actions from
_rollback_live_migration function to live_migration_abort
function.

Closes-bug: #1949808
Change-Id: Iea193ce8ae7a076051c6d2672ae62852f71e68f5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix clean-up process for aborted queued live migrations

Bug #1949808 describes one of the problems affecting aborted queued
live migrations: VM's status is not reverted back to ACTIVE and
VM is left in MIGRATING state.

However that's not the single problem with aborted queued live
migrations: some changes (port bindings on destination host,
resource allocations and possibly instance's pci_requests)
are introduced by Nova control plane before live migration
actually started by source compute host. Those left-overs
should also be removed.

Multiple ways to achieve this were considered:

1. There is existing _rollback_live_migration function used to
   revert changes introduced during pre_live_migration and
   live_migration phases. Unfortunately this function contains
   a lot of extra calls related to BDMs, driver and even
   RPC calls for destination hypervisor which are not needed
   for queued live migrations: Nova Compute didn't took any
   steps for such migrations and sofisticated rollback is not
   needed.
2. We can run few extra steps and finish pre_live_migration
   tasks and then try to revert everything. Hovewer it looks
   irrational and error-prone to take extra steps to set up
   things and intentionally destroy them shortly after.

As a result, it looks rational to simply copy proper actions from
_rollback_live_migration function to live_migration_abort
function.

Closes-bug: #1949808
Change-Id: Iea193ce8ae7a076051c6d2672ae62852f71e68f5

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft

Due to a build problem with the reactive plugin, this change falls back
on overriding the steps and doing a manual build, but it also ensures
the CI system builds the charm using charmcraft.  Changes:

- add a build-requirements.txt
- modify charmcraft.yaml
- modify osci.yaml
    -> indicate build with charmcraft
- modify tox.ini
    -> tox -e build does charmcraft build/rename
    -> tox -e build-reactive does the reactive build
- modify bundles to use the <charm>.charm artifact in tests.
  and fix deprecation warning re: prefix
- tox inception to enable tox -e func-test in the CI

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-nova-cell-controller/+/830520
Change-Id: I47fd77c67776817f7b8d8918f0ec29d420f1763a

commit_message:
Publish the Zed Cycle signing key for future use

This adds a listing for the Zed Cycle key fingerprint without a
start date yet, and links to an export of the corresponding public
key with initial attestation signature from the Yoga Cycle key as
well as the change author.

Change-Id: I15ced779782163fc9e85b5ba10481a076aafdf2c

commit_message:
Remove iscsi deploy interface support for Xena+

This is inline with upstream removal of the iscsi deploy
interface in OpenStack Xena. [1]

Additional changes include:
* Switch to sorted(list) as list.sort() returns None
* Switch to deepcopy(PACKAGES) to prevent changing the constant

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/929907d68473ae8a433ebb8c4dcb110473d42676

Closes-Bug: #1952140
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.openstack/+/822039
Change-Id: If7fdf6083cf298ee3932ee84a9e9d0bcd053686a

commit_message:
Use [database]/connection in templates

nova-manage uses the [database]/connection to determine the
database connection. This change updates the nova.conf
template to use the parts/section-database template,
switching away from using [DEFAULT]/sql_connection to use
[database]/connection instead.

[DEFAULT/sql_connection has been deprecated since at least
mitaka:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/mitaka/sample_config.html

This change also re-enables the gate tests for Xena.

Closes-Bug: #1951874
Change-Id: I9d77b44ad3c40f3ee60fedc3f211f3ac085fcbb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 09:24:08.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails

When trying to attach a volume to an already running instance the nova-api
requests the nova-compute service to create a BlockDeviceMapping. If the
nova-api does not receive a response within `rpc_response_timeout` it will
treat the request as failed and raise an exception.

There are multiple cases where nova-compute actually already processed the
request and just the reply did not reach the nova-api in time (see bug report).
After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry
for the volume + instance combination that will never be cleaned up again.
This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527
(cherry picked from commit 9eb116b99ce32bc69c4abf8ec3b0179ef89a8860)

After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry

This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527
(cherry picked from commit 9eb116b99ce32bc69c4abf8ec3b0179ef89a8860)

commit_message:
Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails

When trying to attach a volume to an already running instance the nova-api
requests the nova-compute service to create a BlockDeviceMapping. If the
nova-api does not receive a response within `rpc_response_timeout` it will
treat the request as failed and raise an exception.

There are multiple cases where nova-compute actually already processed the
request and just the reply did not reach the nova-api in time (see bug report).
After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry
for the volume + instance combination that will never be cleaned up again.
This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527
(cherry picked from commit 9eb116b99ce32bc69c4abf8ec3b0179ef89a8860)

This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created

commit_message:
Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails

When trying to attach a volume to an already running instance the nova-api
requests the nova-compute service to create a BlockDeviceMapping. If the
nova-api does not receive a response within `rpc_response_timeout` it will
treat the request as failed and raise an exception.

There are multiple cases where nova-compute actually already processed the
request and just the reply did not reach the nova-api in time (see bug report).
After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry
for the volume + instance combination that will never be cleaned up again.
This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't require Virtualisation Technology (VT)

Hosts used for development, test or CI may not have Virtualization
Technology (VT) enabled. Don't fail if it's disabled.

Story: 2009858
Task: 44496

Change-Id: Ie7f9e5f6682985e08c5bd22441f9ba6aee34b64a

commit_message:
Add master branch detection for collection jobs

And set all variables or overridden branch

Currently if we override stable branch, we don't set all variables,
which breaks jobs on stable branches with "override_branch" settings.

Change-Id: I9eb0c324ec8720e659450a30f33c43b2b617d8d6

commit_message:
Install python3-devel - building netifaces c9 content provider

As seen in related bug we need this for the c9 wallaby content
provider. Also fixes existing bug where we install only the
first in PYTHON_PACKAGES ignoring the rest.

Related-Bug: 1961736
Change-Id: I16e2bf179d462420942ff1d293b5541c587ff9e8

subject: Support multiple links in link_local_information dict of portgroups
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 16006, 'name': 'goldyfruit', 'email': 'gaetan.trellu@incloudus.com', 'username': 'goldyfruit'}, {'_account_id': 16011, 'name': 'James Denton', 'email': 'james.denton@outlook.com', 'username': 'busterswt'}, {'_account_id': 21032, 'name': 'Farid Da Encarnacao', 'email': 'farid.daencarnacao@ormuco.com', 'username': 'haplo37'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}, {'_account_id': 24828, 'name': 'Kaifeng Wang', 'email': 'kaifeng.w@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangkf'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21032, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-28 07:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-28 11:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-30 23:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Guys, do I need to add a release note?!'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-03-31 01:15:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm kinda feel the title may be misleading, LACP can be as broad as a generic concept or specific to 802.3ad protocol.

If we will support a bonding mode, then it's an RFE, otherwise I think it's a bug. I believe both warrant a release note. For what I see, I think you are fixing a bug.

Also we need unit tests here."}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-31 01:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-31 01:46:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Kaifeng Thanks for you feedback.
I change the bug ID and the title, I'll have a look on the unit test."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-03-31 11:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just another thing, you need to do similar changes for _unplug_port_from_network to reset tags when ports are removed.
As you are still working on unit test, I'm not leaving a -1 for this patchset :)"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hi Gaetan, thanks for your patch. Please see [1] from Zachary Ma, which aims to add support for port groups.

I expect that this patch is for supporting statically defined port groups. In my experience, the VLAN association is normally added to the master interface on the switch, rather than the slave links as you are doing here. Perhaps there is a switch where this is done differently?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551922/'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-04 01:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Mark, I think it's reasonable to set same tag to all slave links, as  there are cases that bond mode is switch independent."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:24:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Hi Mark, I think it's reasonable to set same tag to all slave
 > links, as  there are cases that bond mode is switch independent.

Kaifeng,

I'm fairly sure that if you try to do this on most switches I've used, it will fail. The bond slaves become subordinate to the master and cannot have some types of configuration applied to them, including VLANs.

Gaetan, perhaps you could provide more about your environment. Switch manufacturer & devices, network topology, some config snippets etc."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-08 00:45:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Mark, I understand your concerns, but you are speaking of the majority, for some scenario I know doesn't require this enforcement.
Currently we support using Windows Server 2012 as a guest OS, this system doesn't require any configuration on the switch, as long as the tag is set up accordingly.

I also noticed mode 5 and 6 in the linux bonding driver don't require special switch config too (though I have not used these two modes), but this makes me think it represents some vendor or scenario specific thing, we probably should leave it to device drivers beneath, instead of apply the restriction on mech layer."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Hi Mark, I understand your concerns, but you are speaking of the
 > majority, for some scenario I know doesn't require this
 > enforcement.
 > Currently we support using Windows Server 2012 as a guest OS, this
 > system doesn't require any configuration on the switch, as long as
 > the tag is set up accordingly.
 > 
 > I also noticed mode 5 and 6 in the linux bonding driver don't
 > require special switch config too (though I have not used these two
 > modes), but this makes me think it represents some vendor or
 > scenario specific thing, we probably should leave it to device
 > drivers beneath, instead of apply the restriction on mech layer.

Kaifeng, thanks for clarifying - it helps to know use cases involved. Although the commit message does specify LACP which presumably would not work without the switch being involved.

All that said - we can't accept this patch in its current form. Applying the VLAN to all interfaces in the group clearly won't work in many cases.

At this point I am inclined to block all patches adding bonding/port group support until we have a spec or other design document that brings together the various use cases and proposes a solution that works for them all.

Gaetan, please communicate with Zachary Ma, Li Xiao and other interested parties. I'd be happy to be involved with design of this feature."}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-04-12 21:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-12 23:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

In regards to the discussion, I do completely agree, we need a better idea of the use cases in which this is useful. I'm fairly certain this would work on one of the switches that I have, but I'm also fairly sure this would fail completely on some of the switches that I've used networking-generic-switch on.

A good first step might be unit tests, where it could be expressed where this is a valid case. Unit tests would also be helpful.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-04-12 23:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks for your comments guys.

For me it was just a "bug" that we faced but it's seems to be more complicated. I don't have the knowledge to go further. :/

Feel free to take the review.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-13 08:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

> Thanks for your comments guys.
 > 
 > For me it was just a "bug" that we faced but it's seems to be more
 > complicated. I don't have the knowledge to go further. :/
 > 
 > Feel free to take the review.

Gaetan, perhaps it would be best to abandon this change and for you to join the review of the spec [1] to ensure that your use case is described and supported.

commit_message:
Support multiple links in link_local_information dict of portgroups

This patch applies configuration to all links present in
the local_link_information dictionary and not only to the first one.

With these changes, bonding modes not requiring special switch configurations
should be supported, including:

Mode 1: Active/Backup
Mode 5: Transmit Load Balancing (TLB)
Mode 6: Adaptive Load Balancing (ALB)

Change-Id: Ic3e10d19315b776662188f41c552fe0676a12782
Closes-Bug: #1759000

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-13 15:03:02.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Support volumes backed by VStorageObject

vSphere 6.5 introduced APIs to manage virtual disks (volumes)
as first class objects. The new managed disk entity is called
VStorageObject aka First Class Disk (FCD). Adding support for
volumes backed by VStorageObject.

Change-Id: I4a5a9d3537dc175508f0a0fd82507c498737d1a5

commit_message:
VMware: Support volumes backed by VStorageObject

vSphere 6.5 introduced APIs to manage virtual disks (volumes)
as first class objects. The new managed disk entity is called
VStorageObject aka First Class Disk (FCD). Adding support for
volumes backed by VStorageObject.

Change-Id: I4a5a9d3537dc175508f0a0fd82507c498737d1a5

[{'created': '2022-01-24 01:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'dhcp-all-interfaces: let NetworkManager doit.

On RHEL and CentOS release 8 and later the
dhcp-all-interfaces element is now configured to only
apply NetworkManager configuration. The service:
dhcp-all-interfaces will not be enabled.

Not enabling the service allows NetworkManager to do the
interface auto-configuration. In release 8 and later it
should do this just as good, or even better, compared to
the dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script.

The dhcp-all-interfaces element is still writing configuration
for NetworkManager.

Depends-On: Id6f8d6aaaf52a78175bb6c065ec88274c364834e
Change-Id: I12950733bfe54cae62d299b4c5987449d551857a

commit_message:
dhcp-all-interfaces: let NetworkManager doit.

Override the default for DIB_DHCP_NETWORK_MANAGER_AUTO
to `true` on RHEL and CentOS release 8 and later.

The dhcp-all-interfaces element is configured to only
apply NetworkManager configuration. The service:
dhcp-all-interfaces will not be enabled. Not enabling the
service allows NetworkManager to do the interface auto-
configuration. In release 8 and later it should do this
just as good, or even better, compared to the
dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script.

Depends-On: Id6f8d6aaaf52a78175bb6c065ec88274c364834e
Change-Id: I12950733bfe54cae62d299b4c5987449d551857a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-11 00:58:21.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Closes-Bug: #1929421
(cherry picked from commit c1db551775c512e42001a8183975f1abbc4c5253)
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Closes-Bug: #1929421
(cherry picked from commit c1db551775c512e42001a8183975f1abbc4c5253)

Cirros partition images are not compatible with local boot since they
don't ship grub (nor a normal root partition). This change adds a script
that builds a partition image with UEFI artifacts present. It still
cannot be booted in legacy mode, but it's a progress.

Set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option. We need it to inform

commit_message:
CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default

Cirros partition images are not compatible with local boot since they
don't ship grub (nor a normal root partition). This change adds a script
that builds a partition image with UEFI artifacts present. It still
cannot be booted in legacy mode, but it's a progress.

Set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option. We need it to inform
the tempest plugin about the ability to do local boot. This option
already exists but is never set.

Also set the new default_boot_option parameter, which will be introduced
and used in Iaba563a2ecbca029889bc6894b2a7f0754d27b88.

Remove netboot from most of the UEFI jobs.

Conflicts:
	devstack/files/bindep.txt
	zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml

bugfix/18.1 addition: set the correct override for ironic in the jobs,
otherwise it uses stable/xena.

Change-Id: I15189e7f5928126c6b336b1416ce6408a4950062
(cherry picked from commit bbceca562e0b552cd2fc33b2833931ab3cbbfce5)

commit_message:
Removing playbooks section from default molecule config

Most local molecule configs don't have the playbooks section so it's
using the default one (from config.yml), but the default one is invalid
for most scenarios.

Change-Id: I1811640e3aeee112da74b3459c897601082f05d0

subject: CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2022-02-21 14:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2022-02-21 14:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch stable/wallaby.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-inspector-tempest-partition-bios-redfish-vmedia
      description: "Inspect and deploy ironic node over Redfish virtual media using legacy BIOS boot mode"
      parent: ironic-tempest-partition-uefi-redfish-vmedia
      required-projects:
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
      vars:
        # NOTE(dtantsur): the inspector job includes booting an instance too.
        # Excluding the abort tests since it hits "node locked" too often.
        tempest_test_regex: test_baremetal_introspection
        devstack_localrc:
          IRONIC_BOOT_MODE: bios
          IRONIC_DEFAULT_BOOT_OPTION: netboot
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGED_BOOT: True
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_NODE_NOT_FOUND_HOOK: ''
          IRONIC_AUTOMATED_CLEAN_ENABLED: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic-inspector: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
        devstack_services:
          ironic-inspector: True
          ironic-inspector-dhcp: True

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@stable/wallaby", line 241, column 3
For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2022-02-23 08:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 14:39:51.000000000', 'message': "CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode

We need configdrives to pass information reliably, and the new cirros
image does not work without them.

Change-Id: I6cafa050d5c1c8289483f968d26c50485fd4528a
(cherry picked from commit 2f09b7b1026551cb5818436a3714260fee9fcac4)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode

We need configdrives to pass information reliably, and the new cirros
image does not work without them.

Change-Id: I6cafa050d5c1c8289483f968d26c50485fd4528a
(cherry picked from commit 2f09b7b1026551cb5818436a3714260fee9fcac4)

commit_message:
[WALLABY ONLY]Fix lint failures

This will backport "Fix lint failures" patch sent to master:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/827138

The cherry-pick has many conflicts, there'd be many changes from
the original commit, so I decided to just pick the updates that
are valid for wallaby.

commit_message:
CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode

We need configdrives to pass information reliably, and the new cirros
image does not work without them.

Change-Id: I6cafa050d5c1c8289483f968d26c50485fd4528a
(cherry picked from commit 2f09b7b1026551cb5818436a3714260fee9fcac4)

commit_message:
Import ceph_spec from tripleo-common

Originally only tripleo-ansible required this library but
now python-tripleoclient will also require it. Depends-on
patch moves it to tripleo-common and this patch updates
its references to to ceph_spec to use tripleo-common.

Also, tag ceph_spec portions of deployed ceph playbook.

Change-Id: Id771a6075b626f6ec853be17384d3bdd7c327c53

subject: Release final python-swiftclient for Yoga
messages: [{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2022-02-21 16:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2022-02-23 05:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2022-02-23 09:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2022-02-23 09:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 16:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-swiftclient for Yoga

This is a release for python-swiftclient to get any merged but unreleased
changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 25th.

commit_message:
Release final python-swiftclient for Yoga

This is a release for python-swiftclient to get any merged but unreleased
changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 25th.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.13.0..4989d94
4989d94 Fix copy.py example.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I10d717ae3444b0bd4cb80493c507abad295972d7

Heat IdMServer can not convey multiple values of IPA servers,
and it is set to a string, limited to one IPA server only.

commit_message:
IDM server registration is fixed to one server only

Heat IdMServer can not convey multiple values of IPA servers,
and it is set to a string, limited to one IPA server only.

Since IPA ansible playbook can accept multiple values of servers,
IdMServer needs update to be changed from string to array.

Closes-Bug: #1955319
Change-Id: I4cc8837b52e6b2356b6bc4436c340b2cb83879fe
(cherry picked from commit 6d142165f12a03bd3d0b27ed3b377e48b6a8ad5b)

commit_message:
Allow to create ovn loadbalancer on dual-stack provider networks

This patch ensures that loadbalancer can be created with the VIP
on the provider networks when they are dual-stack (ipv4 and ipv6
subnets).

NOTE: added neutron_lib import constants to make use of the same
constant used in master, otherwise pep8 gate was failing.

Closes-Bug: #1959903
Change-Id: Ic0e6c02defb5c98791a3c3d99ff2b7cfc0ccfe2e
(cherry picked from commit 1ac25e88140cd0fc2111fe0c91cb7162e2d8399a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 16:27:22.000000000', 'message': "Check gateway IP while looking for LR plugged to LS

When LB or member is created, driver looks for the Logical Router which
is plugged to the Logical Switch (Neutron network). As there can be more
than one router connected to one network, we should always store in
Loadbalancer's external_ids ID of the router which is used as default
gateway for the VIP's subnet.
This patch changes _find_lr_of_ls() method of the
ovn_octavia_provider.helper.OvnProviderHelper class so it checks
subnet's gateway IP while looks for the logical router.

Closes-bug: #1949059
(manually cherry picked from commit ee800e165469dec8c492893c5ba64d4be7cc3170)

Change-Id: I771f39ba190623857af208e23d8228c4bdc0db20
"}]
commit_message:
Check gateway IP while looking for LR plugged to LS

When LB or member is created, driver looks for the Logical Router which
is plugged to the Logical Switch (Neutron network). As there can be more
than one router connected to one network, we should always store in
Loadbalancer's external_ids ID of the router which is used as default
gateway for the VIP's subnet.
This patch changes _find_lr_of_ls() method of the
ovn_octavia_provider.helper.OvnProviderHelper class so it checks
subnet's gateway IP while looks for the logical router.

Closes-bug: #1949059
(manually cherry picked from commit ee800e165469dec8c492893c5ba64d4be7cc3170)

Change-Id: I771f39ba190623857af208e23d8228c4bdc0db20

commit_message:
Build the new cirros image even when netboot is the default

The standalone job changes boot_option in runtime, so local boot
can be used even when the default boot option is netboot.

Change-Id: Ia538907f3662e8cd84d988ea5d862c7f488558e1
(cherry picked from commit 7ac480412626c38fa3493088dbf49e29303491b6)

commit_message:
Add support for 'remote-managed' vnic type

The 'remote-managed' vnic type will be used to support off-path
SmartNIC port binding with OVN, and it is expected that the user
will create ports with this vnic type as part of the workflow.

As such the client must allow users to interact with this
vnic type and this patch addresses that.

Partial-Bug: #1932154
Depends-On: I496db96ea40da3bee5b81bcee1edc79e1f46b541
Change-Id: I566c3da594d757dd62edcf7f9ea3077db8d6b11a

commit_message:
Add IronicNeutronAgentReportInterval parameter

Add IronicNeutronAgentReportInterval with a default of
30 seconds.

Previously the ironic-neutron-agent used the global report
interval in neutron. The global interval was increased to
300s in change: Ib3f7cd9d6c050140a5e8b59adf7fd8f65b12df2f.

While the 300s interval may make sense for other agents,
the ironic-neutron-agent can keep reporting at 30s, the
previous default.

Conflicts:
  deployment/ironic/ironic-neutron-agent-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1940838
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/828409
Change-Id: Id77662e9dd466ec8609354c2dbeee8592f599e72
(cherry picked from commit 9574cd4d0f65fd6f7a5a6e04379f8bc4fd6c020c)

commit_message:
Switch TripleO jobs to CentOS 9

With [1] CentOS8 Tripleo Jobs are dropped for
master in favor of CentOS9 jobs and since it merged
periodic pipeline of neutron is not running, switch
to CentOS9 based jobs to fix it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/826317

Change-Id: Ic1a5c1ab96d9e33b2158be25e638ed2e3c5aacd5

commit_message:
[CI] Fix CI jobs

rally-dsvm-manila-multibackend and
rally-dsvm-manila-multibackend-no-ss were old
jobs whose definition was removed a while ago, however,
the check pipeline on this repo had these jobs
and this config error was not surfaced until
recently [1]. Replace these older jobs with the
correct ones.

The lower constraints job should only be run on
master, since it provides little value to stable branches
we've already shipped. We do not allow requirements
changes in these branches lightly. [2][3][4]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-November/025797.html
[2] http://pyfound.blogspot.com/2020/11/pip-20-3-new-resolver.html
[3] https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#changes-to-the-pip-dependency-resolver-in-20-3-2020
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html
Change-Id: I4a7de404bd02887e7a7b37fff8ce449846109cbb
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1f72195d316d8fc4fafad107c81d134aae2210b7)
(cherry picked from commit 406ae1c65e63c30bdf68ee613ca753a5bd3e94ca)
(cherry picked from commit 1412265e0a957ecb6462bbfc00e1dcc790e7fc28)
(cherry picked from commit 3feef0c6b2a188c90fa9a6a0415f4dec9f536bd0)
(cherry picked from commit 11d95ccefe1c1f17a123a578f500435e3c60f73c)
(cherry picked from commit 5526d1f311d2b31ef7ce5383029f51ec16937b85)

commit_message:
fix: Fix the mtu when create network

Remove mtu if it is empty

If the mtu is empty, it should be removed
from the params of the request, otherwise it will cause
createing net error

Change-Id: I88f1d4398efd2ee70ab984d7598b04f8743c8d66

commit_message:
Build the new cirros image even when netboot is the default

The standalone job changes boot_option in runtime, so local boot
can be used even when the default boot option is netboot.

Change-Id: Ia538907f3662e8cd84d988ea5d862c7f488558e1
(cherry picked from commit 7ac480412626c38fa3493088dbf49e29303491b6)

commit_message:
Build the new cirros image even when netboot is the default

The standalone job changes boot_option in runtime, so local boot
can be used even when the default boot option is netboot.

Change-Id: Ia538907f3662e8cd84d988ea5d862c7f488558e1
(cherry picked from commit 7ac480412626c38fa3493088dbf49e29303491b6)

commit_message:
Use centos amphora image in the FIPS jobs

The FIPS jobs use centos-8-stream controllers but the image is still
based on ubuntu, this commit updates the amphora images to
centos-8-stream and enable FIPS inside the amphora.

Change-Id: I8916796ed6727a103907a33d3c14e99e1d3734e6

commit_message:
WIP: Enable TLS on haproxy VIPs and backends by default

This patch is an example of how an automatic upgrade
of an existing deployment from HTTP to HTTPS for internal
communications to and from Haproxy can be implemented.

All frontends could have TLS enabled, but currently only Glance
has support for TLS on its backend.

This is required because just enabling TLS for haproxy would
cause downtime of the APIs.

Work needs to be completed on documentation and possible
extra CI check as AIO already has TLS on all VIPs enabled
and the CI tests do not check that the APIs worked throughout
the upgrade.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/829899
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/821090
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/830474

Change-Id: Idcf1fb545aff1d2f61b187f3eed81b03a8716ae1

commit_message:
feat(removal): tox-ansible support

This patch removes the support of tox-ansible from
tripleo-validations. Due to several issues with pip dependencies
management and our requirements files, the installation of this latter
doesn't work.

This patch also removes the `tripleo-linters` anchor and nodeset line
for the `openstack-tox-linters` check job as they are not used or useful
here.

JIRA: #VALFRWK702

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I02d70e9eaf112d9d9137a020c8b236c150a12149
(cherry picked from commit 01ae2b4ea2a07d702f4fb4e8e6acb367dbc609d4)
(cherry picked from commit fcb1ed21dfa6d58a15edb9a9418ac835ca5c1023)

commit_message:
Swap coreutils-single for coreutils in Rocky Linux container builds

nodepool builds failing due to RPM conflict in these two packages which
is a result of using the RL container as the source for this build. Easy
enough to fix.

Change-Id: I463b732e79b7249923e46b49df73f7193b1c9886
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/829942

to 12345 which is invalid and will cause issues in designate.

designate.conf default value (which is a valid UUID).

'}, {'created': '2022-02-22 17:31:53.000000000', 'message': 'Set managed_resource_tenant_id default to service default

commit_message:
Set managed_resource_tenant_id default to service default

The managed_resource_tenant_id default is currently set
to 12345 which is invalid and will cause issues in designate.

We should use service default instead so that it gets the
designate.conf default value (which is a valid UUID).

Change-Id: Ice64a6d244f8b463382d91bcc7f0600816abacd2

commit_message:
Ensure auth_endpoint is reset

The auth_endpoint variable is loaded from cinder.conf, thus it should
be cleared when configurations loaded by cinder.conf is cleared.

Change-Id: Id651d5c5c7cb9794ab159bf2e129422af0a33bfa

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-27 16:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add microversion 1.39 to support any-trait queries

The new microversion adds support for the ``in:`` syntax in the ``required``
query parameter in the ``GET /resource_providers`` API as well as to the
``required`` and ``requiredN`` query params of the
``GET /allocation_candidates`` API. Also adds support for repeating the
``required`` and ``requiredN`` parameters in the respective APIs. So

  required=in:T3,T4&required=T1,!T2

is supported and it means T1 and not T2 and (T3 or T4).

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: I66543c0c5509739d1461af2fb2c327a003202d74
'}, {'created': '2022-01-28 18:28:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add microversion 1.39 to support any-trait queries

``required`` and ``requiredN`` parameters in the respective APIs. So

commit_message:
Add microversion 1.39 to support any-trait queries

The new microversion adds support for the ``in:`` syntax in the ``required``
query parameter in the ``GET /resource_providers`` API as well as to the
``required`` and ``requiredN`` query params of the
``GET /allocation_candidates`` API. Also adds support for repeating the
``required`` and ``requiredN`` parameters in the respective APIs. So

  required=in:T3,T4&required=T1,!T2

is supported and it means T1 and not T2 and (T3 or T4).

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: I66543c0c5509739d1461af2fb2c327a003202d74

commit_message:
Remove unused compatibility code

During the development of the any-traits feature the signature of the DB
methods are changed and to allow gradual change in the caller sites
fallback logic was added to accept the old signature as well.
Now that all the call sites uses a new signature such code is removed.

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: Icdbdbb8e68bba37a2a5c1ffb81df231581c4ae02

and replace hard-codes by definition in params.pp .

Add support for Cache API

This change provides support for the Cache API changes and
deprecation path for glance-cache-manage command.

'}, {'created': '2022-01-27 16:15:23.000000000', 'message': "Add any-traits support for allocation candidates

The patch I8704fe7350f74e0567e574eb00fc40b330817381 added support for
any-traits in the DB query when considering RP trees. This patch extends
the allocation candidates code path to be able to parse the extended
'in:' syntax of the 'required' query parameter as well as to handle the
nested required trait structure both in the unnamed and in the name
request groups.

This patch refers to microversion 1.39 which has not been added yet so
the changes in this patch cannot be triggered from the REST API. A later
patch will add the microversion bump.

Note that supporting the 'in:' syntax in root_required query param was
not planned and it is not implemented as part of this patch series and
API microversion.

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: I760be29201bce8dfc6d4e571bc8a842404eaff09

commit_message:
Add any-traits support for allocation candidates

The patch I8704fe7350f74e0567e574eb00fc40b330817381 added support for
any-traits in the DB query when considering RP trees. This patch extends
the allocation candidates code path to be able to parse the extended
'in:' syntax of the 'required' query parameter as well as to handle the
nested required trait structure both in the unnamed and in the name
request groups.

This patch refers to microversion 1.39 which has not been added yet so
the changes in this patch cannot be triggered from the REST API. A later
patch will add the microversion bump.

Note that supporting the 'in:' syntax in root_required query param was
not planned and it is not implemented as part of this patch series and
API microversion.

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: I760be29201bce8dfc6d4e571bc8a842404eaff09

subject: Slurp constraints.txt separately for each host in a batch
messages: [{'account_id': 32666, 'date': '2022-02-15 14:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2022-02-22 15:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-02-22 16:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-15 14:10:28.000000000', 'message': "Slurp constraints.txt separately for each host in a batch

Currently playbook slurps constraints.txt valid for a first host in a
batch and then uses it for each other host.

It saves time but batch may consists of hosts with different operating
systems or even OSA versions and current mechanism doesn't take this
into account.

In my opinion we should slurp constraints.txt separately for each host.

Change-Id: I9ba1d342af13e9c923151f735940bda29bf1b262
"}]
commit_message:
Slurp constraints.txt separately for each host in a batch

Currently playbook slurps constraints.txt valid for a first host in a
batch and then uses it for each other host.

It saves time but batch may consists of hosts with different operating
systems or even OSA versions and current mechanism doesn't take this
into account.

In my opinion we should slurp constraints.txt separately for each host.

Change-Id: I9ba1d342af13e9c923151f735940bda29bf1b262

commit_message:
Revert "Switch Keystone to DPL"

This reverts commit 48a02a308e73eb0c2fc57c758b23e1b1c25f66bb.

Reason for revert: For the current election cycle Z we
have a candidate who wishes to run for PTL. As a result,
keystone will look to switching back from the DPL model
back to PTL driven.

Change-Id: I673e7bfd360b438abb2fd7f66b32c225c566c4d1

(22 comments)

Thank you for working on this change, Haixin! I have addressed few comments inline for you... Please check them :)

Also, I have an additional question:
Should other operations envolving shares be blocked as well?
Like:
- should we allow shares to be extended/shrinked when they are soft deleted?
- should we allow requests to update the share access?
- should we allow the share to be unmanaged
These and any other scenarios we might have...'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-08-31 07:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

(20 comments)

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> (22 comments)
> 
> Thank you for working on this change, Haixin! I have addressed few comments inline for you... Please check them :)
> 
> Also, I have an additional question:
> Should other operations envolving shares be blocked as well?
> Like:
> - should we allow shares to be extended/shrinked when they are soft deleted?
> - should we allow requests to update the share access?
> - should we allow the share to be unmanaged
> These and any other scenarios we might have...

thanks for your review, Carlos Eduardo.
in summary, The share in the recycle bin allows the following operations:
1: Various Viewing operations
2: restore share.
3: delete share.

Nothing else is allowed. I'll put restrictions on everything"}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-08-31 10:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(2 comments)

Hi haixin, thanks for proposing this feature.
I think that we can also add a validation and block operations like share-server-migration and security-service-update if a share server has at least one share as soft-delete == True.
Both validation can be made at share-api, in '_migration_initial_checks' and '_share_network_update_initial_checks'. What do you think?

Unfortunately, we've passed the feature freeze deadline and this change wasn't merged by then. Are you still looking to have this in the Xena release? If you are - you'll need to request a Feature Freeze Exception via the openstack-discuss mailing list. 
If you file the request, we can discuss this at the Manila IRC Meeting tomorrow and take a call. I think we have had some reviews, but I would definitely like some more eyes. 

Here are some recent Feature Freeze exception discussions:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024649.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-14 08:36:08.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Manila share support Recycle Bin

Add support share Recycle Bin, the end user can soft delete
share to Recycle Bin, and can restore the share within 7 dyas,
otherwise the share will be deleted automatically

Partially-Implements: blueprint manila-share-support-recycle-bin

Change-Id: Ic838eec5fea890be6513514053329b1d2d86b3ba

commit_message:
Update micversion to API2.69, Manila share support Recycle Bin

Add support share Recycle Bin, the end user can soft delete
share to Recycle Bin, and can restore the share within 7 days,
otherwise the share will be deleted automatically.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint manila-share-support-recycle-bin

Change-Id: Ic838eec5fea890be6513514053329b1d2d86b3ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-19 10:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'nova-libvirt: Fix broken log level for 'log_outputs'

Change-ID I6db952002b6d5f3d2efa65498db520526614d96b (Use
OS::TripleO::Services::Logging::NovaLibvirt to configure libvirt
logging") introduced libvirt logging.

However, it has misconfigured the log level for 'log_outputs',
preventing any useful outputs being captured.  I.e. as it stands, the
result is this (in libvirtd.conf):

    log_outputs="3:file:/var/log/libvirt/libvirtd.log"

Notice the "3:" there.  It will *not* capture critical logs.  This patch
changes it to:

    log_outputs="1:file:/var/log/libvirt/libvirtd.log"

Notice the change from "3:" to "1:".  This is critical for the
LibvirtLogFilters to take effect.  The "1:" means:

    Store the debug logs (and higer) in the log file — but this doesn't
    mean that ALL libvirt debug messages will go into the file (and thus
    make it grow out of the bounds); only the carefully selected log
    filters that TripleO configures will be captured.  See:
    LibvirtLogFilters in nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml.

PS: Consider removing the 'virtlogd.log' file in a separate change.
    Currenlty it is misconfigured so it isn't even logged; and the value
    of 'virtlogd.log' itself is questionable.

Change-Id: Ie4d29551b00caec7e0f757da2055518e9894ef02
'}]
commit_message:
nova-libvirt: Fix broken log level for 'log_outputs'

Change-ID I6db952002b6d5f3d2efa65498db520526614d96b (Use
OS::TripleO::Services::Logging::NovaLibvirt to configure libvirt
logging") introduced libvirt logging.

However, it has misconfigured the log level for 'log_outputs',
preventing any useful outputs being captured.  I.e. as it stands, the
result is this (in libvirtd.conf):

    log_outputs="3:file:/var/log/libvirt/libvirtd.log"

Notice the "3:" there.  It will *not* capture critical logs.  This patch
changes it to:

    log_outputs="1:file:/var/log/libvirt/libvirtd.log"

Notice the change from "3:" to "1:".  This is critical for the
LibvirtLogFilters to take effect.  The "1:" means:

    Store the debug logs (and higer) in the log file — but this doesn't
    mean that ALL libvirt debug messages will go into the file (and thus
    make it grow out of the bounds); only the carefully selected log
    filters that TripleO configures will be captured.  See:
    LibvirtLogFilters in nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml.

PS: Consider removing the 'virtlogd.log' file in a separate change.
    Currenlty it is misconfigured so it isn't even logged; and the value
    of 'virtlogd.log' itself is questionable.

Change-Id: Ie4d29551b00caec7e0f757da2055518e9894ef02

commit_message:
[queens] Removed passing Tests from skiplist

Class neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario has maximum
number of tests passing that why removed and
only failing test(test_qos) is kept.

Also adding two more tests from Class ServersOnMultiNodesTest which
fails randomly and were missed in review [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700443/

Related-Bug: #1857365
Related-Bug: #1737940
Change-Id: I38da3aaf93d34ad8296e2395c013b3e83c744ddb

commit_message:
Support use_multipath for NVME driver

Initiate connector for LibvirtNVMEVolumeDriver driver with
use_multipath argument.

Change-Id: I20f6aa2d422259601c44d024099cd5760a8e21c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-14 13:56:49.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Off-path SmartNIC Port Binding with OVN

This code provides an initial draft that together with the OVN
plug provider [0] and Nova PoC (see the depends on link) allows
PoC of the entire proposed solution. The Neutron RFE can be found
in https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1932154 which also has
links to the specs.

Adds support for binding ports of type VNIC_SMARTNIC by looking up
chassis based on serial number that Nova provides in the
binding_profile.

Information required by the OVN controller to successfully look up
and plug representor port is provided as options on the LSP as
defined by the representor plug provider documentation [0].

'}, {'created': '2021-11-18 16:03:33.000000000', 'message': "WIP ovn: Off-path SmartNIC DPU Port Binding with OVN

Traditionally it has been the CMSs, in OpenStacks case Nova's,
responsibility to create Virtual Interfaces (VIFs) as part of
instance life cycle, and subsequently manage plug/unplug operations
on the Open vSwitch integration bridge.

With the advent of SmartNIC DPUs which are connected to multiple
distinct CPUs we can have a topology where the instance runs on one
host and Open vSwitch and OVN runs on a different host, the
SmartNIC DPU control plane CPU.

One of the main use cases for having this topology is security
where we treat the hypervisor host as untrusted and prohibit
direct communication between the hypervisor host and the SmartNIC
DPU control plane host.  In addition to that control facilities
such as switchdev devices are only visible from the SmartNIC DPU
control plane CPUs.

Adds support for binding ports of type VNIC_SMARTNIC by looking up
chassis based on serial number that Nova provides in the
binding_profile.

Information required by the OVN controller to successfully look up
and plug representor port is provided as options on the LSP as
defined by the representor plug provider documentation [0][1][2].

TODO: Add unit tests.

TODO: Add documentation.

TODO: Add release note.

RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1932154
0: https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/ovn/list/?series=267834&state=3
1: https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/ovn/list/?series=270569&state=3
2: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn-vif
Depends-On: I6445433142286728a8c7efadcf80d07082d60bc3
Change-Id: Icc6c2d0f7f8f5cc94997db6244175a8e8884789f

"}, {'created': '2022-01-31 16:48:52.000000000', 'message': "WIP ovn: Off-path SmartNIC DPU Port Binding with OVN

Traditionally it has been the CMSs, in OpenStacks case Nova's,
responsibility to create Virtual Interfaces (VIFs) as part of
instance life cycle, and subsequently manage plug/unplug operations
on the Open vSwitch integration bridge.

With the advent of SmartNIC DPUs which are connected to multiple
distinct CPUs we can have a topology where the instance runs on one
host and Open vSwitch and OVN runs on a different host, the
SmartNIC DPU control plane CPU.

One of the main use cases for having this topology is security
where we treat the hypervisor host as untrusted and prohibit
direct communication between the hypervisor host and the SmartNIC
DPU control plane host.  In addition to that control facilities
such as switchdev devices are only visible from the SmartNIC DPU
control plane CPUs.

Adds support for binding ports of type VNIC_SMARTNIC by looking up
chassis based on serial number that Nova provides in the
binding_profile.

Information required by the OVN controller to successfully look up
and plug representor port is provided as options on the LSP as
defined by the representor plug provider documentation [0][1].

TODO: Complete the functional tests.

TODO: Add documentation.

TODO: Add release note.

0: https://docs.ovn.org/en/stable/topics/vif-plug-providers/vif-plug-providers.html
1: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn-vif/blob/main/Documentation/topics/vif-plug-providers/vif-plug-representor.rst
Closes-Bug: #1932154
Depends-On: I83a128a260acdd8bf78fede566af6881b8b82a9c
Change-Id: Icc6c2d0f7f8f5cc94997db6244175a8e8884789f

commit_message:
[OVN] Off-path SmartNIC DPU Port Binding with OVN

Traditionally it has been the CMSs, in OpenStacks case Nova's,
responsibility to create Virtual Interfaces (VIFs) as part of
instance life cycle, and subsequently manage plug/unplug operations
on the Open vSwitch integration bridge.

With the advent of SmartNIC DPUs which are connected to multiple
distinct CPUs we can have a topology where the instance runs on one
host and Open vSwitch and OVN runs on a different host, the
SmartNIC DPU control plane CPU.

One of the main use cases for having this topology is security
where we treat the hypervisor host as untrusted and prohibit
direct communication between the hypervisor host and the SmartNIC
DPU control plane host.  In addition to that control facilities
such as switchdev devices are only visible from the SmartNIC DPU
control plane CPUs.

Adds support for binding ports of type VNIC_REMOTE_MANAGED by
looking up chassis based on serial number that Nova provides in
the binding_profile.

Information required by the OVN controller to successfully look up
and plug representor port is provided as options on the LSP as
defined by the representor plug provider documentation [0][1].

0: https://docs.ovn.org/en/stable/topics/vif-plug-providers/vif-plug-providers.html
1: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn-vif/blob/main/Documentation/topics/vif-plug-providers/vif-plug-representor.rst
Partial-Bug: #1932154
Depends-On: I496db96ea40da3bee5b81bcee1edc79e1f46b541
Depends-On: I83a128a260acdd8bf78fede566af6881b8b82a9c
Change-Id: Icc6c2d0f7f8f5cc94997db6244175a8e8884789f

commit_message:
Improve connectivity check

Currently, the ICMP check can fail if the network
configuration takes too long. This can fail the
overall deployment, but the network configuration
can still be successful. This change broadens the
scope of the connectivity check by increasing the
number of IMCMP requests sent each time. To make
it more flexibile and allowing for situations where
interfaces take a little longer to become active.

Resolves: rhbz#2053404
Change-Id: I9eac272df3a99c6869c752ae779d52848a9ad78f

commit_message:
Add the PROMETHEUS protocol to listeners

This patch adds a new protocol for listeners called "PROMETHEUS" that exposes
a Prometheus endpoint. This allows detailed metrics collection from Octavia
load balancers.

Change-Id: I3e27e4e57ad955bcd7728426c91f05171a46ef7f

commit_message:
Add FIPS CI jobs

Added jobs to run the swift functional tests when FIPS is enabled.
We'll set these jobs to be non-voting initially, so that we can
ensure that they are stable.

Change-Id: If0b4cfc1ac9a8c66085eb4dc95366d43806d5ae2

Its configuration must match one in Ironic, and using netboot exposes
an issue in the Ironic's devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Ia207e80bbfc30f8d2891e11bbeda7b2ab0d617c0
"}, {'created': '2022-02-21 17:56:09.000000000', 'message': 'Stop defaulting the standalone job to netboot; use the correct boot mode

Its configuration must match one in Ironic, and netboot does not work
with whole disk images under UEFI.

Fix the boot mode of the BIOS job: it was running in UEFI.

Change-Id: Ia207e80bbfc30f8d2891e11bbeda7b2ab0d617c0
'}]
commit_message:
Stop defaulting the standalone job to netboot; use the correct boot mode

Its configuration must match one in Ironic, and netboot does not work
with whole disk images under UEFI.

Fix the boot mode of the BIOS job: it was running in UEFI.

Change-Id: Ia207e80bbfc30f8d2891e11bbeda7b2ab0d617c0

[{'created': '2022-02-17 15:40:15.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying
this mistake around.

See https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-skipsdist
and https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/1388 for details.

commit_message:
Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying
this mistake around.

See https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-skipsdist
and https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/1388 for details.

Change-Id: I7880955f656cb171395a62689678c263829bee8b
(cherry picked from commit 56adfba6d0a5aa52124846a79f28bd58462b2b21)
(cherry picked from commit 1d0b42fb3e4637a646c7168d3b83913b380cc095)
(cherry picked from commit 9197ba0adf4ee491d982af204c6fe7c190f45a71)

module is enabled, avoiding other hacks in tasks that need to be

commit_message:
Loads dependency vars before start repo-setup tasks

This patch ensures that specific vars are loaded when dependency
jobs are triggered, before they start setting up repos.
It adds tripleo-repos installation as root when use of yum-config
module is enabled, avoiding other hacks in tasks that need to be
executed with root user.

Change-Id: Ia69af35c4c14d1eedccb16f89b88565083a7ffa5
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for container sharder

This patch ensure that the swift-container-sharder service is started,
and provides all the facility (ie: parameters) to configure the sharder.
