Change-Id: I71b7312879dab6857255c78c21ad8dd45d5ea00f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-02 22:11:00.000000000', 'message': 'Raise InstanceNotFound on fkey constraint fail saving info cache

We have seen tracebacks in the gate in the nova-multi-cell job during
cross-cell migrations of a failure to save an instance info cache due
to a foreign key constraint violation on instance_uuid. This can occur
if we happen to receive an external event from neutron after the
instance record has been moved to the destination cell.

This adds a catch of DBReferenceError from oslo.db and raises
InstanceNotFound if the key is instance_uuid, else it reraises.

One more step is required to prevent tracing which is to log INFO
instead of EXCEPTION in the case of an InstanceNotFound. Then reraise
it for callers to handle.

Closes-Bug: #1944787

Change-Id: I71b7312879dab6857255c78c21ad8dd45d5ea00f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-03 19:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Raise InstanceNotFound on fkey constraint fail saving info cache

We have seen tracebacks in the gate in the nova-multi-cell job during
cross-cell migrations of a failure to save an instance info cache due
to a foreign key constraint violation on instance_uuid. This can occur
if we happen to receive an external event from neutron after the
instance record has been moved to the destination cell.

This:

  (1) Adds a catch of DBReferenceError from oslo.db and raises
      InstanceNotFound if the key is instance_uuid, else it reraises.

  (2) Changes call of Logger.exception() to Logger.info() to log at
      level INFO instead of level ERROR in the case of an InstanceNotFound.
      Then reraises InstanceNotFound for callers to handle.

  (3) Adds @messaging.expected_exceptions(InstanceNotFound) to the
      InstanceInfoCache.save() method in order to prevent logging of
      tracebacks from the RPC messaging layer in the case of
      InstanceNotFound.

Closes-Bug: #1944787

commit_message:
Raise InstanceNotFound on fkey constraint fail saving info cache

We have seen tracebacks in the gate in the nova-multi-cell job during
cross-cell migrations of a failure to save an instance info cache due
to a foreign key constraint violation on instance_uuid. This can occur
if we happen to receive an external event from neutron after the
instance record has been moved to the destination cell.

This adds a catch of DBReferenceError from oslo.db and raises
InstanceNotFound if the key is instance_uuid, else it reraises.

One more step is required to prevent tracing which is to log at level
INFO instead of level ERROR in the case of InstanceNotFound. Then
reraise it for callers to handle.

Closes-Bug: #1944787

Change-Id: I71b7312879dab6857255c78c21ad8dd45d5ea00f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-04 08:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Prevent leaked eventlets to send notifications

In out functional tests we run nova services as eventlets. Also those
services can spawn there own eventlets for RPC or other parallel
processing. The test case executor only sees and tracks the main
eventlet where the code of the test case is running. When that is
finishes the test executor considers the test case to be finished
regardless of the other spawned eventlets. This could lead to leaked
eventlets that are running in parallel with later test cases.

One way that it can cause trouble is via the global variables in
nova.rpc module. Those globals are re-initialized for each test case so
they are not directly leaking information between test cases. However if
a late eventlet calls nova.rpc.get_versioned_notifier() it will get a
totally usable FakeVersionedNotifier object regardless of which test
case this notifier is belongs to or which test case the eventlet belongs
to. This way the late eventlet can send a notification to the currently
running test case and therefore can make it fail.

The current case we saw is the following:

1) The test case
  nova.tests.functional.test_servers.ServersTestV219.test_description_errors
  creates a server but don't wait for it to reach terminal state (ACTIVE
  / ERROR). This test case finishes quickly but leaks running eventlets
  in the background waiting for some RPC call to return.
2) As the test case finished the cleanup code deletes the test case
   specific setup, including the DB.
3) The test executor moves forward and starts running another test case
4) 60 seconds later the leaked eventlet times out waiting for the RPC
   call to return and tries doing things, but fails as the DB is already
   gone. Then it tries to  report this as an error notification. It calls
   nova.rpc.get_versioned_notifier() and gets a fresh notifier that is
   connected to the currently running test case. Then emits the error
   notification there.
5) The currently running test case also waits for an error notification
   to be triggered by the currently running test code. But it gets the
   notification form the late eventlet first. As the content of the
   notification does not match with the expectations the currently
   running test case fails. The late eventlet prints a lot of
   error about the DB being gone making the troubleshooting pretty hard.

This patch proposes a way to fix this by marking each eventlet at spawn
time with the id of the test case that was directly or indirectly
started it.

Then when the NotificationFixture gets a notification it compares the
test case id stored in the calling eventlet with the id of the test case
initialized the NotificationFixture. If the two ids do not match then
the fixture ignores the notification and raises an exception to the
caller eventlet to make it terminate.

Change-Id: I012dcf63306bae624dc4f66aae6c6d96a20d4327
Closes-Bug: #1946339
(cherry picked from commit 61fc81a6761d34afdfc4a6d1c4c953802fd8a179)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent leaked eventlets to send notifications

In out functional tests we run nova services as eventlets. Also those
services can spawn there own eventlets for RPC or other parallel
processing. The test case executor only sees and tracks the main
eventlet where the code of the test case is running. When that is
finishes the test executor considers the test case to be finished
regardless of the other spawned eventlets. This could lead to leaked
eventlets that are running in parallel with later test cases.

One way that it can cause trouble is via the global variables in
nova.rpc module. Those globals are re-initialized for each test case so
they are not directly leaking information between test cases. However if
a late eventlet calls nova.rpc.get_versioned_notifier() it will get a
totally usable FakeVersionedNotifier object regardless of which test
case this notifier is belongs to or which test case the eventlet belongs
to. This way the late eventlet can send a notification to the currently
running test case and therefore can make it fail.

The current case we saw is the following:

1) The test case
  nova.tests.functional.test_servers.ServersTestV219.test_description_errors
  creates a server but don't wait for it to reach terminal state (ACTIVE
  / ERROR). This test case finishes quickly but leaks running eventlets
  in the background waiting for some RPC call to return.
2) As the test case finished the cleanup code deletes the test case
   specific setup, including the DB.
3) The test executor moves forward and starts running another test case
4) 60 seconds later the leaked eventlet times out waiting for the RPC
   call to return and tries doing things, but fails as the DB is already
   gone. Then it tries to  report this as an error notification. It calls
   nova.rpc.get_versioned_notifier() and gets a fresh notifier that is
   connected to the currently running test case. Then emits the error
   notification there.
5) The currently running test case also waits for an error notification
   to be triggered by the currently running test code. But it gets the
   notification form the late eventlet first. As the content of the
   notification does not match with the expectations the currently
   running test case fails. The late eventlet prints a lot of
   error about the DB being gone making the troubleshooting pretty hard.

This patch proposes a way to fix this by marking each eventlet at spawn
time with the id of the test case that was directly or indirectly
started it.

Then when the NotificationFixture gets a notification it compares the
test case id stored in the calling eventlet with the id of the test case
initialized the NotificationFixture. If the two ids do not match then
the fixture ignores the notification and raises an exception to the
caller eventlet to make it terminate.

Change-Id: I012dcf63306bae624dc4f66aae6c6d96a20d4327
Closes-Bug: #1946339
(cherry picked from commit 61fc81a6761d34afdfc4a6d1c4c953802fd8a179)

commit_message:
Add resource properties discovery API

This allows users to query for resource properties of hosts,
allowing them to be used in creating leases more effectively. Two new
API endpoints are added for hosts, ``/properties`` and
``/properties/<property_name>``, which allow for listing available
properties, and updating a property respectively. Properties can be
listed with detail, showing possible values and visibility. Admins can
list public and private properties.

A new database table is added ``resource_properties``, which stores
property names and resource types. Resource specific property tables
(e.g. ``computehost_extra_capabilities``) entries store a foreign key to
``resource_properties``, rather than the capability name.

Implements blueprint resource-properties-discovery-api

Change-Id: Ib9f1140c44c5e4fbef6e019c48a842869368cb21

commit_message:
Use configured endpoint type in url_for

The url_for function was defaulting to the public endpoint if no
specific endpoint type was passed as argument.

Also switch from admin to internal keystone endpoint by default and
replace use of a hardcoded endpoint type by the corresponding
configuration option.

As explained in [1], a recent devstack change switched off the creation
of an admin endpoint for keystone. Now that we support configuring
endpoint types, switch to using the public interface for keystone when
deploying blazar with devstack.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/blazar/+/816627

Change-Id: If20c20f6cfb6aa23cb6e19020301bf59044aa79c

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: I8a57a9ae84668d67dd29dd819152716b366461a4

commit_message:
Install openstack.kolla collection

This change adds an Ansible Galaxy requirements file including the
openstack.kolla collection. A new 'kolla-ansible install-deps' command
is provided to install the requirements.

With the new collection in place, this change also switches to using the
baremetal role from the openstack.kolla collection, and removes the
baremetal role from this repository.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-collection-kolla/+/820168

Change-Id: I9708f57b4bb9d64eb4903c253684fe0d9147bd4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-10 11:49:21.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: sync default inspection UEFI iPXE bootloader with Ironic

The bootloader used to boot Ironic nodes in UEFI boot mode during
inspection when iPXE is enabled has been changed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. This is in line with the default UEFI iPXE bootloader used
in Ironic since the Xena release. The bootloader may be changed via
ironic_dnsmasq_uefi_ipxe_boot_file.

Note that snponly.efi was not available via in the ironic-pxe image
prior to I79e78dca550262fc86b092a036f9ea96b214ab48.

Related-Bug: #1959203

Change-Id: I879db340769cc1b076e77313dff15876e27fcac4
'}]
commit_message:
ironic: sync default inspection UEFI iPXE bootloader with Ironic

The bootloader used to boot Ironic nodes in UEFI boot mode during
inspection when iPXE is enabled has been changed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. This is in line with the default UEFI iPXE bootloader used
in Ironic since the Xena release. The bootloader may be changed via
ironic_dnsmasq_uefi_ipxe_boot_file.

Note that snponly.efi was not available via in the ironic-pxe image
prior to I79e78dca550262fc86b092a036f9ea96b214ab48.

Related-Bug: #1959203

Change-Id: I879db340769cc1b076e77313dff15876e27fcac4

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Prometheus libvirt exporter

Add support for deploying the Kolla Prometheus libvirt exporter image to
facilitate gathering metrics from the Nova libvirt service.

Co-Authored-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Ib27e60c39297b86ae674297370f9543ab08cda05
Partially-Implements: blueprint libvirt-exporter

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-19 12:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add ovs-record-hostname to deferable service list

The ovs-record-hostname service was introduced in the openvswitch SRU
for bug #1915829, however this service did not make the deferable
services list for the neutron-gateway charm. This causes package
upgrades to restart the openvswitch-switch service. Add the
ovs-record-hostname to the deferable services list in order to prevent
unintended restarts of openvswitch-switch.

Closes-Bug: #1955498
Change-Id: I24a32f6f5a5c51b8b8ee62f88a973a126106fcd9
'}]
commit_message:
Add ovs-record-hostname to deferable service list

The ovs-record-hostname service was introduced in the openvswitch SRU
for bug #1915829, however this service did not make the deferable
services list for the neutron-gateway charm. This causes package
upgrades to restart the openvswitch-switch service. Add the
ovs-record-hostname to the deferable services list in order to prevent
unintended restarts of openvswitch-switch.

Closes-Bug: #1955498
Change-Id: I24a32f6f5a5c51b8b8ee62f88a973a126106fcd9

Ensure tox.ini is ASCII

The left/right single quotation marks cause an ascii decode error in
some python3.6 environments.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-08 12:38:11.000000000', 'message': "Clean up allocations left by evacuation when deleting service

When a compute node goes down and all instances on the compute node
are evacuated, allocation records about these instance are still left
in the source compute node until nova-compute service is again started
on the node. However if a compute node is completely broken, it is not
possible to start the service again.
In this situation deleting nova-compute service for the compute node
doesn't delete its resource provider record, and even if a user tries
to delete the resource provider, the delete request is rejected because
allocations are still left on that node.

This change ensures that remaining allocations left by successful
evacuations are cleared when deleting a nova-compute service, to avoid
any resource provider record left even if a compute node can't be
recovered. Migration records are still left in 'done' status to trigger
clean-up tasks in case the compute node is recovered later.

Closes-Bug: #1829479
Change-Id: I3ce6f6275bfe09d43718c3a491b3991a804027bd
(cherry picked from commit e5a34fffdf97fcda7d0abfdc9e23485479ca2c4f)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up allocations left by evacuation when deleting service

When a compute node goes down and all instances on the compute node
are evacuated, allocation records about these instance are still left
in the source compute node until nova-compute service is again started
on the node. However if a compute node is completely broken, it is not
possible to start the service again.
In this situation deleting nova-compute service for the compute node
doesn't delete its resource provider record, and even if a user tries
to delete the resource provider, the delete request is rejected because
allocations are still left on that node.

This change ensures that remaining allocations left by successful
evacuations are cleared when deleting a nova-compute service, to avoid
any resource provider record left even if a compute node can't be
recovered. Migration records are still left in 'done' status to trigger
clean-up tasks in case the compute node is recovered later.

Closes-Bug: #1829479
Change-Id: I3ce6f6275bfe09d43718c3a491b3991a804027bd
(cherry picked from commit e5a34fffdf97fcda7d0abfdc9e23485479ca2c4f)

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft

Due to a build problem with the reactive plugin, this change falls back
on overriding the steps and doing a manual build, but it also ensures
the CI system builds the charm using charmcraft.  Changes:

- add a build-requirements.txt
- modify charmcraft.yaml
- modify osci.yaml
    -> indicate build with charmcraft
- modify tox.ini
    -> tox -e build does charmcraft build/rename
    -> tox -e build-reactive does the reactive build
- modify bundles to use the <charm>.charm artifact in tests.
  and fix deprecation warning re: prefix
- tox inception to enable tox -e func-test in the CI

Change-Id: Iee0101df1f2a943f3da8ad8b5719bdaa031af151

I was on vacation last week.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-09-14 13:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-09-15 13:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-09-16 09:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-09-17 06:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-09-17 09:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2021-09-17 13:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

ERROR [Threshold]: \x1b[39mFailed minimum coverage threshold expectations
npm ERR! Test failed.  See above for more details.

Looks like the new JavaScript code requires tests.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-09-21 07:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

I tried your patch and have several feedbacks.
My feedbacks focus on larger points. Minor nits are not covered.

- I don't think the two-step form is required to create a rule. As many forms in horizon do, you can show more fields conditionally depending on a rule type selected. "Next" button would be unnecessary. This allows users to move back to the rule type selction without moving back to "Add Rule" button.
- In "Edit rule", it is not easy to distinguish which rule you would like to edit based on a rule ID. It is nice to show more information than ID and rule type. For example, "DSCP marking: 8", "Minimum Bandwidth (100Mbps, egress)", "Bandwidth Limit (500Mbps, burst: 0, egress)" and so on.
- Another idea to edit rules is to add "Edit" button in the rule table in the QoS policy detail. It would be more straight-forward.
- Regarding the rule table in the QoS policy detail, I don't think it works to define all available columns. If we have more rule types, we will have more and more columns and only a few columns will be used. My suggestion is to sort rules per type and show rule details as "Rule Definition" (or "Rule Detail") column. For example, "Mark: 8" for DSCP, "100Mbps, egress" for min bw, "500Mbps, burst: 0, egress" for bw limit.
- Only specific set of values is allowed for DSCP mark, so it would be really nice to have some help message. Normal users cannot remember which values are allowed.
- In the "Add Rule" form, QoS policy ID provides almost no information to users. QoS policy name would be more useful. This is what horizon does in most places.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-10-06 10:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-10-08 09:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 33643, 'date': '2021-10-08 11:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1
> 
> I tried your patch and have several feedbacks.
> My feedbacks focus on larger points. Minor nits are not covered.
> 
> - I don't think the two-step form is required to create a rule. As many forms in horizon do, you can show more fields conditionally depending on a rule type selected. "Next" button would be unnecessary. This allows users to move back to the rule type selction without moving back to "Add Rule" button.
> - In "Edit rule", it is not easy to distinguish which rule you would like to edit based on a rule ID. It is nice to show more information than ID and rule type. For example, "DSCP marking: 8", "Minimum Bandwidth (100Mbps, egress)", "Bandwidth Limit (500Mbps, burst: 0, egress)" and so on.
> - Another idea to edit rules is to add "Edit" button in the rule table in the QoS policy detail. It would be more straight-forward.
> - Regarding the rule table in the QoS policy detail, I don't think it works to define all available columns. If we have more rule types, we will have more and more columns and only a few columns will be used. My suggestion is to sort rules per type and show rule details as "Rule Definition" (or "Rule Detail") column. For example, "Mark: 8" for DSCP, "100Mbps, egress" for min bw, "500Mbps, burst: 0, egress" for bw limit.
> - Only specific set of values is allowed for DSCP mark, so it would be really nice to have some help message. Normal users cannot remember which values are allowed.
> - In the "Add Rule" form, QoS policy ID provides almost no information to users. QoS policy name would be more useful. This is what horizon does in most places.

Made changes according to your comments. Could you please review the flow again.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-10-11 13:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add Rules operation to Network QoS Policy

Added create, edit, and delete rules operation to the
network qos policy.
Rules: Minimum-Bandwidth, DSCP-Marking, and
Bandwidth-Limit, Minimum-Packet-Rate

Partially-Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/create-network-qos-policy

Change-Id: I49058036f1d78ef022d966f6b375cdc984755813

commit_message:
[OVN] Migrate "reside-on-redirect-chassis" for distributed FIP

This patch complement the changes made at
828765412789a15a5f375060cfab7628c65e9d5d by creating a maintenance task
resposible for migrating the "reside-on-redirect-chassis" option value
for existing router ports when the deployment is updated.

Conflicts:
  neutron/common/ovn/constants.py
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
  neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py

Change-Id: I0c623a101357226ec0b4e3e42b829303846b6f6b
Related-Bug: #1920976
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bef86847790f60bf2cb87903db8b9ef88051623)

commit_message:
update gpg / file verification for Gentoo

Gentoo updated the layout and files for vaidating stages
At least we can validate cryptographically and infer valid checksum now.

https://www.gentoo.org/news/2022/02/17/changed-signatures.html

Change-Id: I708b44419ae53dec2c19a2210ef427dcd2eb6002
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-14 15:43:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fail on parse_dom if vif quota sizes > 32 bit unsigned int

Fail on parse_dom if vif quota sizes > 32 bit unsigned int in order
to avoid crypting failure later on when calling "tC" which fails
with : 'Illegal "buffer"' when a quota size is bigger than
4,294,967,295.

Change-Id: I8a9b150815313b1a694363bb31e5ac509c912643
'}, {'created': '2022-02-14 15:50:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fail on parse_dom if vif quota sizes > 32 bit unsigned int

Fail on parse_dom if vif quota sizes > 32 bit unsigned int in order
to avoid cryptic message failure later on when calling "tc" which
fails with : 'Illegal "buffer"' when a quota size is bigger than
4,294,967,295.   This patch will at least let the operator know
exactly why it's failing to spawn the requested domain with
requested flavor and avoid providing a value that is higher than
the documented "tc" maximum value as of this:
```
"TC stores sizes internally as 32-bit unsigned integer in byte,
so we can specify a max size of 4294967295 bytes."
```

Change-Id: I8a9b150815313b1a694363bb31e5ac509c912643
'}, {'created': '2022-02-14 16:18:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fail on parse_dom if vif quota sizes > 32 bit unsigned int

Validate burst value is equal or smaller than 4194303 in order
to avoid cryptic message failure later on when calling "tc" which
fails with : 'Illegal "buffer"' when a quota size is bigger than
4,294,967,295.  Libvirt is requesting the burst value as "kb" as
per the documented "tc" maximum value:
 ```
"TC stores sizes internally as 32-bit unsigned integer in byte,
so we can specify a max size of 4294967295 bytes."
```
so any values bigger than 4194303 when converted to kb will
go above the 4294967295 limit.

Change-Id: I8a9b150815313b1a694363bb31e5ac509c912643

commit_message:
Validate burst value is equal or smaller than 4194303

Validate burst value is equal or smaller than 4194303 in order
to avoid cryptic message failure later on when calling "tc" which
fails with : 'Illegal "buffer"' when a quota size is bigger than
4,294,967,295.  Libvirt is requesting the burst value as "kb" as
per the documented "tc" maximum value:
 ```
"TC stores sizes internally as 32-bit unsigned integer in byte,
so we can specify a max size of 4294967295 bytes."
```
so any values bigger than 4194303 when converted to kb will
go above the 4294967295 limit.

Change-Id: I8a9b150815313b1a694363bb31e5ac509c912643
Closes-bug: #1960840

commit_message:
CI: Restrict tempest run on sushy

Tempest has evolved and expects fake-hardware to be
present in order to run all of the various api contract
tests, however in this case we only need to run the scenario
test, so lets restrict things down to the basic scenario tests.

Change-Id: Ibf6833c2f1fec786bc5ea95ad5f07133e418399e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2022-01-24 00:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2022-02-09 03:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2022-02-15 08:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2022-02-21 17:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-24 00:46:05.000000000', 'message': "dhcp-all-interfaces: opt let NetworkManager doit.

NetworkManager is quite capable to do automatic
interface configuration. NetworkManager will by default
try to auto-configure any interface with no configuration.
It will use DHCP for IPv4 and Router Advertisements to
decide how to initialize IPv6.

It will most likely do it just as good, or better than the
dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script.

Since dhcp-all-interfaces clean out all ifcfg files in
60-remove-cloud-image-interfaces it means NetworkManager will
by default attempt auto configuration for all interfaces.

This change add's and environment variable:
  DIB_DHCP_NETWORK_MANAGER_AUTO (default: false)

When DIB_DHCP_NETWORK_MANAGER_AUTO is set to `true` only the
NetworkManager config will be written. The dhcp-all-interfaces
service will not be installed. Hence dhcp-all-interfaces will
not write any config files, allowing NetworkManager to just do
it's thing.

Change-Id: Id6f8d6aaaf52a78175bb6c065ec88274c364834e
"}]
commit_message:
dhcp-all-interfaces: opt let NetworkManager doit.

NetworkManager is quite capable to do automatic
interface configuration. NetworkManager will by default
try to auto-configure any interface with no configuration.
It will use DHCP for IPv4 and Router Advertisements to
decide how to initialize IPv6.

It will most likely do it just as good, or better than the
dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script.

Since dhcp-all-interfaces clean out all ifcfg files in
60-remove-cloud-image-interfaces it means NetworkManager will
by default attempt auto configuration for all interfaces.

This change add's and environment variable:
  DIB_DHCP_NETWORK_MANAGER_AUTO (default: false)

When DIB_DHCP_NETWORK_MANAGER_AUTO is set to `true` only the
NetworkManager config will be written. The dhcp-all-interfaces
service will not be installed. Hence dhcp-all-interfaces will
not write any config files, allowing NetworkManager to just do
it's thing.

Change-Id: Id6f8d6aaaf52a78175bb6c065ec88274c364834e

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: Ieab82b0547f52e435d075de5b771287372ef8f20

commit_message:
[OVN] Migrate "reside-on-redirect-chassis" for distributed FIP

This patch complement the changes made at
828765412789a15a5f375060cfab7628c65e9d5d by creating a maintenance task
resposible for migrating the "reside-on-redirect-chassis" option value
for existing router ports when the deployment is updated.

Conflicts:
  neutron/common/ovn/constants.py
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
  neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py

Change-Id: I0c623a101357226ec0b4e3e42b829303846b6f6b
Related-Bug: #1920976
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bef86847790f60bf2cb87903db8b9ef88051623)

commit_message:
Note the deleyad address view

The addresses field containes delayed (cached) information,
due to internal implementation details.
This used to be considered API contact breakage,
but apperently no plan for fixing it.

Change-Id: I8db2800ede0276d60138369ec2d60c55a1791040

subject: Declarative configuration for RabbitMQ Policies
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-13 14:22:53.000000000', 'message': 'Declarative configuration for RabbitMQ Policies

Policies can be declared through juju config or relation.

* BasePolicy that can configure any RabbitMQ policies
* TTL and HA policies that generate automatically the definition
* Compares the policies in the config with the cluster and log if
It’s inconsistent (will not change manually implemented policies)
* Applies a policy on all vhosts when ‘*’ is used in the vhost field
* Store policies and users in local database to avoid rabbitmqctl calls

Change-Id: Ib3209b9821690d73f441908d647bf17d0c2f97a9
'}, {'created': '2022-01-13 16:27:37.000000000', 'message': 'Declarative configuration for RabbitMQ Policies

Policies can be declared through juju config or relation.

* BasePolicy that can configure any RabbitMQ policies
* TTL and HA policies that generate automatically the definition
* Compares the policies in the config with the cluster and log if
It’s inconsistent (will not change manually implemented policies)
* Applies a policy on all vhosts when ‘*’ is used in the vhost field
* Store policies and users in local database to avoid rabbitmqctl calls

Change-Id: Ib3209b9821690d73f441908d647bf17d0c2f97a9
'}, {'created': '2022-01-13 18:27:26.000000000', 'message': 'Declarative configuration for RabbitMQ Policies

* BasePolicy that can configure any RabbitMQ policies

commit_message:
Declarative configuration for RabbitMQ Policies

Policies can be declared through juju config or relation.

* BasePolicy that can configure any RabbitMQ policies
* TTL and HA policies that generate automatically the definition
* Compares the policies in the config with the cluster and log if
It’s inconsistent (will not change manually implemented policies)
* Applies a policy on all vhosts when ‘*’ is used in the vhost field
* Store policies and users in local database to avoid rabbitmqctl calls

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/706

Change-Id: Ib3209b9821690d73f441908d647bf17d0c2f97a9

subject: WIP: Strip overrides for jsonrpc settings
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-27 00:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 04:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The json_rpc class is not included by any other classes, thus this is used only when a user explicitly includes this in their manifests.

If you are concerned that the feature would unexpectedly enabled, I don't think that can happen. The user is including the class by himself/herself so they should understand what this is."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 04:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, IIUC jsonrpc is not enabled unless rpc_transport is explicitly set to json-rpc, so even if this class is included, all of these definitions are unused unless the parameter is not set.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Also, IIUC jsonrpc is not enabled unless rpc_transport is explicitly set to json-rpc, so even if this class is included, all of these definitions are unused unless the parameter is not set.

Indeed. It is still a WIP, but unfortunately the defaults are bad defaults to have embedded. If we choose to support such in product, then we need to explicitly pass all known good/valid/correct values into the parameters and have no defaults embedded in an intermediate layer.

The same likely goes for all service communication configuration across the whole of all projects, since with Secure RBAC, we actually need to be able to change the configuration to not be project focused authentication as the concept of a service project is no longer valid as that usage needs to shift to the system itself.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:51:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

These defaults are based on current standard definition of keystone credentials and I'd recommend keeping the current standard now to keep consistency among modules.
Once we establish a standard way to implement system scope credentials, we can start updating these credentials at once."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2022-02-21 18:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-27 00:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Strip overrides for jsonrpc settings

JSON RPC is an alternate to the message bus, but if use it must be
properly configured as it functionally is an attack surface similar
to that of the message bus itself.

As such, this is a highly advanced feature which should only be
used by highly knowledgable and informed operators.

Removes default values and revers them to service defaults.

Change-Id: I924d41043453024e43777be0f1c05bd5ffa5fbf0
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Strip overrides for jsonrpc settings

JSON RPC is an alternate to the message bus, but if use it must be
properly configured as it functionally is an attack surface similar
to that of the message bus itself.

As such, this is a highly advanced feature which should only be
used by highly knowledgable and informed operators.

Removes default values and revers them to service defaults.

Change-Id: I924d41043453024e43777be0f1c05bd5ffa5fbf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-04 18:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Set image_convert_memory_limit to 2048 in CI UC"

This reverts commit d7de30471577c479563d83c4fdb937d72dae8a19 as it was
done for the purposes of CI, however only CI that uses the quickstart
is helped by this, and ultimately this appears to have been an issue
where the underlying error output changed which prevented the retry logic
from catching the falure in low-memory conditions.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-ironic/+/766100

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set image_convert_memory_limit to 2048 in CI UC"

This reverts commit d7de30471577c479563d83c4fdb937d72dae8a19 as it was
done for the purposes of CI, however only CI that uses the quickstart
is helped by this, and ultimately this appears to have been an issue
where the underlying error output changed which prevented the retry logic
from catching the falure in low-memory conditions.

Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-lib/+/766101
Related-Bug: 1879472
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-ironic/+/766100
Change-Id: Ic7e44cc3a1a52a954c9f0511efa0d7f489565a26

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-05 17:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2022-02-07 18:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-02-21 17:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-05 17:11:53.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I32216aeb2128c3e1995492f1f47bd47434a26cb0
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I32216aeb2128c3e1995492f1f47bd47434a26cb0

commit_message:
Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Story: 2008300
Task: 41185
(cherry picked from commit fe01ddb2bce12dc1693d64a30e5b1b822e7b839e)

Conflicts:
	ironic/common/neutron.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/network/common.py

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec
(cherry picked from commit b2ae2af3fa2778079d2f49a0136d97b5547b80a5)

commit_message:
[OVN] Migrate "reside-on-redirect-chassis" for distributed FIP

This patch complement the changes made at
828765412789a15a5f375060cfab7628c65e9d5d by creating a maintenance task
resposible for migrating the "reside-on-redirect-chassis" option value
for existing router ports when the deployment is updated.

Conflicts:
  neutron/common/ovn/constants.py
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
  neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py

Change-Id: I0c623a101357226ec0b4e3e42b829303846b6f6b
Related-Bug: #1920976
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bef86847790f60bf2cb87903db8b9ef88051623)

commit_message:
Do not install extra repos with the zuul configure-mirrors role

These lead to unexpected results when OSA itself is trying to manage
the PowerTools repository.

See https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/829028

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/829021
Change-Id: Ib11b8f6247080b6f43d1b86e83bcb4b02281f1a2

commit_message:
WIP: Bugfix Branch Backport: Validate vmedia for vmedia usage

Virtual media devices based logic needs to be
guarded from being used or considered based upon
if the machine actually booted from virtual media,
or not.

At the same time, actual devices need to be checked
in order to make sure they align with what we expect
in order to prevent consideration of content which
should not be leveraged.

This commit includes content from
Ifffeac9c1c4d394526d655eaa14c9fe7bd3a1e5e.

Change-Id: If2d5c6f4815c9e42798a2d96d59015e1b1dbd457
Story: 2008749
Task: 42108
(cherry picked from commit 8dd6589e66d03e45e1d510601da9531a30842cff)

commit_message:
TEST DNM Revert "Don't try to put a bootloader in place when bootable"

This reverts commit 9f8fa2853af00045118ccd44180e7053e6d027af.

This will hopefully let us see if iDRAC 3rd party UEFI CI was broken by this change.

Change-Id: Ia1974b4a4205534b4c808d26e95b527c0190e3a4

commit_message:
CI: test ironic UEFI boot mode in overcloud TLS jobs

Set the Ironic boot mode to legacy BIOS explicitly in Tenks config in
anticipation of an upcoming change to the default boot mode.

Override the boot mode to UEFI in the overcloud TLS job to improve
coverage. This requires enabling iPXE booting.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tenks/+/827479/

Change-Id: Id1b4e9775c834b8b97e086241ee8b247977225a2
(cherry picked from commit b57b94bbad4333020cc6906d124d6f01f75e1e2c)

commit_message:
CI: test ironic UEFI boot mode in overcloud TLS jobs

Set the Ironic boot mode to legacy BIOS explicitly in Tenks config in
anticipation of an upcoming change to the default boot mode.

Override the boot mode to UEFI in the overcloud TLS job to improve
coverage. This requires enabling iPXE booting.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tenks/+/827479/

Change-Id: Id1b4e9775c834b8b97e086241ee8b247977225a2
(cherry picked from commit b57b94bbad4333020cc6906d124d6f01f75e1e2c)

commit_message:
Add test of used SHAs

We add additional test, that runs bootstarp-ansible.sh and
with that verifies that all roles and collections could be retrieved
from opendev. On top of that it runs extra task that retireves
service_projects and checkout it to the defined SHA.

Test runs only when we change files that we're testing.

Change-Id: I5ad5d4e5b0e59098fae9d185706753397caea6ec

commit_message:
Support searching alarms of one resource in mysql driver of aodh

It can not query alarm in mysql driver by resource id when
we use "get_all" method of AlarmsController by passing
paramter query which includes resource id query. It will
raise error Unknown argument: resource: unrecognized field
in query: [<Query u resource_id eq xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx >].

Change-Id: I569e5d505938df569e93b3da9f2b0a974c6056e1
Closes-bugs: #1740209

subject: infra-package-needs: don't require coreutils for Rocky Linux 8
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2022-02-20 21:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2022-02-21 09:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2022-02-21 16:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-20 21:15:18.000000000', 'message': "infra-package-needs: don't require coreutils for Rocky Linux 8

coreutils comes in two variants now, 'coreutils-single' which is a
busybox-like single binary called through symlinks and the regular
coreutils.  Both satisfy the dependency for coreutils for any other
packages, but if you explicitly ask to install coreutils over
coretuils-single you get an error.

Since coreutils-single is already in the base-image, just skip
installing it on Rocky 8.

Change-Id: I89f8cb49b0cd373e454dd37439bf6efd971233e5
"}]
commit_message:
infra-package-needs: don't require coreutils for Rocky Linux 8

coreutils comes in two variants now, 'coreutils-single' which is a
busybox-like single binary called through symlinks and the regular
coreutils.  Both satisfy the dependency for coreutils for any other
packages, but if you explicitly ask to install coreutils over
coretuils-single you get an error.

Since coreutils-single is already in the base-image, just skip
installing it on Rocky 8.

Change-Id: I89f8cb49b0cd373e454dd37439bf6efd971233e5

commit_message:
[Ussuri-Only] Preventing tox from using local packages

Usage of packages already present on the host can have unintend
consenquences during test runs.

Closes-Bug: #1961302

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If784d1945b2efed8b7bed30c62067371b014b641
(cherry picked from commit 4291886c6a9b21c6bafeff9aaf91a99bc00b6a3a)

messages: [{'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2022-02-20 14:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2022-02-21 12:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-20 14:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "ceph" tags for the TripleO cephadm branch

The 'ceph' tags included in the cephadm tht directory are directly
inherited from the previous ceph-ansible model.  Those tags were useful
to follow a specific ansible flow during update/upgrade scenarios, but
since cephadm is day1 and upgrades from nautilus to pacific are still
managed by ceph-ansible, we don't have to include these tags, that are
cause of issues during minor updates.  In addition, as per [1],
>=pacific updates are asynchronous, hence they should not be managed by
TripleO anymore.

[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/pacific/cephadm/upgrade/#starting-the-upgrade

Change-Id: Id9a6b990c9bc8783f29afca640341962b6a26834
(cherry picked from commit 19b0b7429320d27a480b5e6f2d028b35917fb286)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "ceph" tags for the TripleO cephadm branch

The 'ceph' tags included in the cephadm tht directory are directly
inherited from the previous ceph-ansible model.  Those tags were useful
to follow a specific ansible flow during update/upgrade scenarios, but
since cephadm is day1 and upgrades from nautilus to pacific are still
managed by ceph-ansible, we don't have to include these tags, that are
cause of issues during minor updates.  In addition, as per [1],
>=pacific updates are asynchronous, hence they should not be managed by
TripleO anymore.

[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/pacific/cephadm/upgrade/#starting-the-upgrade

Change-Id: Id9a6b990c9bc8783f29afca640341962b6a26834
(cherry picked from commit 19b0b7429320d27a480b5e6f2d028b35917fb286)

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft

Due to a build problem with the reactive plugin, this change falls back
on overriding the steps and doing a manual build, but it also ensures
the CI system builds the charm using charmcraft.  Changes:

- add a build-requirements.txt
- modify charmcraft.yaml
- modify osci.yaml
    -> indicate build with charmcraft
- modify tox.ini
    -> tox -e build does charmcraft build/rename
    -> tox -e build-reactive does the reactive build
- modify bundles to use the <charm>.charm artifact in tests.
  and fix deprecation warning re: prefix
- tox inception to enable tox -e func-test in the CI

Change-Id: I5d3fb56615043ac65bb19bdc113ef801fbc02c85

subject: Avoid DivByZero if there is no metrics to collect
messages:
[{'account_id': 32589, 'date': '2021-02-12 10:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-02-19 15:22:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have just seen this issue in a test deployment too. However, I don't think your proposed fix is correct. If you look at the first line of the log in the story, it says:

    No data collected for metric net.in_bytes_sec

This means the metrics list object contained at least one element.

futurist's average_runtime is documented as raising a ZeroDivisionError, so we should catch it cleanly."}, {'account_id': 25277, 'date': '2021-02-22 13:43:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree, old measurements might still be present even if nothing's been collected during the collection period.

Either catch the ZeroDivisionError exception, like Pierre said, or check content of the `usage_data` object."}, {'account_id': 32589, 'date': '2021-02-25 10:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You're right. I didn't notice that log message.
I didn't thought about the possibility of previous measures lingering on.
I'm not a big expert of futurist, and I'm not sure I quite get how that scenario is happening.

What I don't get is how "no execution have occured" (which trigger de div by zero) can happen when futs is not the empty list, (obviously it does though), and how futs can be empty if metrics is not.
futs = [tpool.submit(_get_result, metric) for metric in metrics]
...
results = [r.result() for r in waiters.wait_for_all(futs).done]

What am I missing here ?'}, {'account_id': 32589, 'date': '2021-02-25 10:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And what should it log when this happens ? Putting an average_runtime = 0 does not seems right'}, {'account_id': 33546, 'date': '2021-06-28 09:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 33546, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 33546, 'date': '2021-06-28 11:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33546, 'date': '2021-06-28 12:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-07-12 14:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Avoid DivByZero if there is no metrics to collect

Put the futurist.ExecutorStatistic.average_runtime method in a
try/except block, catching the ZeroDivisionError exception
when no executions have occured

Change-Id: Id25051bf2097c108cc79fd587cf549a2adfe15d5
Story: 2006672
Task: 36940
Co-Authored-By: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

commit_message:
Implement pagination in admin/proj network tab

Added pagination support to the networks page under
Project and Admin Dashboard.

To accomplish so, the method network_list_for_tenant
in api/neutron.py that is used for listing networks under
the Project Dashboard was refactored to merge the different
requests for shared, non-shared and external networks while
tracking the pagination for each of those requests, so for
instance when all the shared networks are listed and paginated
then the non-shared networks are queried and so on.

For the Admin dashboard all network types are retrieved under
a single request so it is a simpler pagination logic.

Partial-Bug: #1746184
Change-Id: I96a2d6cabed47c89bdc02ec922d7f9451e5ec025

commit_message:
Allow ovn_db_sync to continue on duplicate normalised CIDR

OVN now uses normalised CIDR when adding a security group rule[1]. It
uses may_exist=True for adding ACL (secgroup rule), in case there are
multiple CIDRs in neutron that normalises to the same.

Do the same in ovn_db_sync, so that the sync don't fail hard on such
duplicates.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/736386/

Change-Id: I9d9c21e460029e4a6a845520bfcc2889ad20429b
Related-Bug: #1869129
Closes-Bug: #1961112

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Add enforce_scope setting support for keystone""

This reverts commit 26bd94b45efb63683072006e4281dd34a313d881.

Reason for revert: Devstack keystone creation/setup are moved to
scope tokens, so we can reintroduce the scope check enable.

Change-Id: I6e1c261196dbcaf632748fb6f04e0867648b76c7

commit_message:
Use devstack-system-admin for keystone objects creation

This is needed so we can set keystone into enforcing secure RBAC.
This also adjusts lib/glance, which already partially used
devstack-system-admin.

Change-Id: I6df8ad23a3077a8420340167a748ae23ad094962

commit_message:
New bugfix release of oslo-rootwrap

This patch proposes a new bugfix release for oslo-rootwrap to include
latest bugfixes.

Change-Id: Idd2e8cf74a9fee48f900750f643eb92a69561f90

commit_message:
Fix description of orchestrator parameters

- coordination_url is not driver URL but backend URL. Driver is
  determined according to the backend.

- The parameter description should not use abbreviations, as these
  can confuse users.

Change-Id: I16eb47e161ae826393d113082091c292d097fc03

commit_message:
Add IronicNeutronAgentReportInterval parameter

Add IronicNeutronAgentReportInterval with a default of
30 seconds.

Previously the ironic-neutron-agent used the global report
interval in neutron. The global interval was increased to
300s in change: Ib3f7cd9d6c050140a5e8b59adf7fd8f65b12df2f.

While the 300s interval may make sense for other agents,
the ironic-neutron-agent can keep reporting at 30s, the
previous default.

Conflicts:
  deployment/ironic/ironic-neutron-agent-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1940838
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/828409
Change-Id: Id77662e9dd466ec8609354c2dbeee8592f599e72
(cherry picked from commit 9574cd4d0f65fd6f7a5a6e04379f8bc4fd6c020c)

subject: CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2022-02-21 10:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2022-02-21 10:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch master.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-inspector-tempest-partition-bios-redfish-vmedia
      description: "Inspect and deploy ironic node over Redfish virtual media using legacy BIOS boot mode"
      parent: ironic-tempest-partition-uefi-redfish-vmedia
      required-projects:
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
      vars:
        # NOTE(dtantsur): the inspector job includes booting an instance too.
        # Excluding the abort tests since it hits "node locked" too often.
        tempest_test_regex: test_baremetal_introspection
        devstack_localrc:
          IRONIC_BOOT_MODE: bios
          IRONIC_DEFAULT_BOOT_OPTION: netboot
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGED_BOOT: True
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_NODE_NOT_FOUND_HOOK: ''
          IRONIC_AUTOMATED_CLEAN_ENABLED: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic-inspector: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
        devstack_services:
          ironic-inspector: True
          ironic-inspector-dhcp: True

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@master", line 264, column 3
For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2022-02-21 12:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2022-02-21 12:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I6cafa050d5c1c8289483f968d26c50485fd4528a
"}]
commit_message:
CI: force config drive on the multinode job's subnode

We need configdrives to pass information reliably, and the new cirros
image does not work without them.

Change-Id: I6cafa050d5c1c8289483f968d26c50485fd4528a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 11:07:08.000000000', 'message': 'Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f
Closes-Bug: #1961438
(cherry picked from commit b210dcd6e2f9c36a71d20f40939660aa5b538144)
'}]
commit_message:
Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f
Closes-Bug: #1961438
(cherry picked from commit b210dcd6e2f9c36a71d20f40939660aa5b538144)

commit_message:
Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f

commit_message:
Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f
Closes-Bug: #1961438
(cherry picked from commit b210dcd6e2f9c36a71d20f40939660aa5b538144)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-10 08:09:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test

In 'test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy' test a QoS policy
is assigned to a network. The network used in this test is created
in resource_setup(), which is run as part of setUpClass() phase.
Resources allocated in resource_setup() are shared by all tests
in the class, and are cleaned up in tearDownClass() only after all
test had been run. This means that
test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test leaks network QoS
policy, that can impact all subsequent tests. Depending on the
order in which tests are run, this can break tests that are
checking port's resource_request attribute.

To avoid affecting other tests, create a dedicated provider network
in test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test.

Related-Bug: #1922237
Change-Id: Id8758ef4fe56fe7e0e7792270d6ee585313592a6

commit_message:
Fix test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test

In 'test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy' test a QoS policy
is assigned to a network. The network used in this test is created
in resource_setup(), which is run as part of setUpClass() phase.
Resources allocated in resource_setup() are shared by all tests
in the class, and are cleaned up in tearDownClass() only after all
test had been run. This means that
test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test leaks network QoS
policy, that can impact all subsequent tests. Depending on the
order in which tests are run, this can break tests that are
checking port's resource_request attribute.

To avoid affecting other tests, create a dedicated provider network
in test_port_resource_request_inherited_policy test.

Related-Bug: #1922237
Change-Id: Id8758ef4fe56fe7e0e7792270d6ee585313592a6

commit_message:
CI: test ironic UEFI boot mode in overcloud TLS jobs

Set the Ironic boot mode to legacy BIOS explicitly in Tenks config in
anticipation of an upcoming change to the default boot mode.

Override the boot mode to UEFI in the overcloud TLS job to improve
coverage. This requires enabling iPXE booting.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tenks/+/827479/

Change-Id: Id1b4e9775c834b8b97e086241ee8b247977225a2

In the production sometimes the provision and other networks should be
separated and all have each own different gateways, so this change adds
the correct way to configure bifrost with gateway used only to configure
dnsmasq and solves the issue with several default routes on the bifrost
host when kolla_bifrost_dnsmasq_router needs to configure.

(cherry picked from commit 0c2a35ed6a87db31c75b250311bb13c3f7bda9c4)

commit_message:
Set correct gateway for the bifrost provision network

In the production sometimes the provision and other networks should be
separated and all have each own different gateways, so this change adds
the correct way to configure bifrost with gateway used only to configure
dnsmasq and solves the issue with several default routes on the bifrost
host when kolla_bifrost_dnsmasq_router needs to configure.

Change-Id: I2078da3ab3898c847b3c17054f429d74eb79aa37
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0c2a35ed6a87db31c75b250311bb13c3f7bda9c4)

commit_message:
Wait longer before deleting DPDK vhu trunk bridges

In [1] we added a delay before deleting DPDK vhu trunk bridges to
mitigate a race condition when instances are rebooted. As explained in
[1], with DPDK rhu, a reboot is esentially a super fast bridge
delete-then-create that is prone to race conditions. We have recently
encountered in customer deployments that the wait added in [1] is not
long enough. As a consequence, this change increases the wait.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/717394

Change-Id: I5c1474b405d436d3b1e5db745d77999f1723b660
Partial-Bug: #1869244
(cherry picked from commit 140bb63665223d7cd2a7fee8c1d1494ebd2a802f)

commit_message:
Add platform:base-py[2|3] to bindep

Ansible playbook from bindep fails to install package
python-devel on python3 environment.
https://opendev.org/opendev/bindep/src/branch/master/playbooks/bindep/run.yaml#L31

Add platform:base-py[2|3] to python devel rpm packages.

Related: RHBZ#2054559

commit_message:
Apply the correct image reference when booting an instance

We seem to be using the Nova's defaults instead. Also verify that the
resulting image type in instance_info is correct.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/827882
Change-Id: Iaba563a2ecbca029889bc6894b2a7f0754d27b88

subject: Fix handling of profile-name
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-18 17:26:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix handling of profile-name

The current code:
self.profile_name = op.get('crush-profile', profile_name)

will only default to profile_name if the 'crush-profile' key
doesn't exist in the op dictionary. If the 'crush-profile' key
exists and is set to None, the default profile_name is not used.

This change will use the default profile_name in both cases.

A full charm-helpers sync is done here.

Closes-Bug: #1960622
Change-Id: If9749e16eadfab5523d06c82f3899a83b8c6fdc1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of profile-name

The current code:
self.profile_name = op.get('crush-profile', profile_name)

will only default to profile_name if the 'crush-profile' key
doesn't exist in the op dictionary. If the 'crush-profile' key
exists and is set to None, the default profile_name is not used.

This change will use the default profile_name in both cases.

A full charm-helpers sync is done here.

Closes-Bug: #1960622
Change-Id: If9749e16eadfab5523d06c82f3899a83b8c6fdc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-20 10:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Install flows to bridge only if the network provider is related

This patch makes it possible that taas agent extension decides based on
network provider information where to install flows.

WARNING: in my environment the multihost setup is not fully working, and
I am not sure if it is a limitation of my environment!

TODO:
* Check SRIOV case
* Make sure multihost setup really works
* More test on "hybrid" setup, i.e.: tap-service port is on tunneled
network, while tap-flow on VLAN network.

commit_message:
WIP: Install flows to bridge only if the network provider is related

This patch makes it possible that taas agent extension decides based on
network provider information where to install flows.

WARNING: in my environment the multihost setup is not fully working, and
I am not sure if it is a limitation of my environment!

TODO:
* Check SRIOV case
* Make sure multihost setup really works
* More test on "hybrid" setup, i.e.: tap-service port is on tunneled
network, while tap-flow on VLAN network.
* Tests
* Documentation

Related-Bug: #1950179
Change-Id: I505deeb379a4f137561893e980847abbcd2430e8

commit_message:
Debian: use libvirt 8 and qemu 6.2

Libvirt 8 got recently backported to bullseye so we can make use of it.
QEMU 6.2 was already available but conflicted with libvirt/bullseye.

Also started listing which packages we want from backports.

Change-Id: I335e5748e9624fe470adbaf6a6f080a3ae468f04

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: I2b4ecddd0aa8b7dfcb3cf739a2f52ef93dc7ecf2

messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2022-02-21 11:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2022-02-21 11:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2022-02-21 12:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 11:16:17.000000000', 'message': 'Don't fail on extlinks warnings for reno build

With Sphinx==4.4.0 some "helpful" warnings were introduced when an
external link could be replaced by a macro, like for :lpbug:. Sadly we
have a very high number of existing release notes that trigger these
warnings and no good way to fix them retrospectively, because would mess
up their mapping to releases. So we change the logging for the
sphinx.ext.extlinks to ignore these warnings for now.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id646d77afc6817921e29eeab3bee75c50021c50b
'}, {'created': '2022-02-21 11:24:53.000000000', 'message': 'Don't fail on extlinks warnings for reno build

With Sphinx==4.4.0 some "helpful" warnings were introduced when an
external link could be replaced by a macro, like for :lpbug:. Sadly we
have a very high number of existing release notes that trigger these
warnings and no good way to fix them retrospectively, because would mess
up their mapping to releases. So we change the logging for the
sphinx.ext.extlinks to ignore these warnings for now.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id646d77afc6817921e29eeab3bee75c50021c50b
'}]
commit_message:
Don't fail on extlinks warnings for reno build

With Sphinx==4.4.0 some "helpful" warnings were introduced when an
external link could be replaced by a macro, like for :lpbug:. Sadly we
have a very high number of existing release notes that trigger these
warnings and no good way to fix them retrospectively, because would mess
up their mapping to releases. So we change the logging for the
sphinx.ext.extlinks to ignore these warnings for now.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id646d77afc6817921e29eeab3bee75c50021c50b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-02 10:52:25.000000000', 'message': "Respect 'interface' key from clouds.yaml

Commit c500b63703 assigned DEFAULT_INTERFACE as the default value of cli
parser's 'interface' key. But this resulted in the 'interface' key from
clouds.yaml aka OSC_Config always being ignored/overridden.

Instead this commit overrides the config default for 'interface' key with
DEFAULT_INTERFACE which can still be overridden with keys 'interface' or
'endpoint_type' in clouds.yaml or via the existing
--os-interface/OS_INTERFACE methods.

Ref.: https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/c500b637033cdf442231684079b041c9e37488fc

Task: 38955
Story: 2007380
Change-Id: Ia4e511c9d47201cca175711e1c4cfa596168202f

clouds.yaml aka OSC_Config always being ignored/overridden.

Instead this commit overrides the config default for 'interface' key with
DEFAULT_INTERFACE which can still be overridden with keys 'interface' or

--os-interface/OS_INTERFACE methods.

commit_message:
Respect 'interface' key from clouds.yaml

Commit c500b63703 assigned DEFAULT_INTERFACE as the default value of cli
parser's 'interface' key. But this resulted in the 'interface' key from
clouds.yaml aka OSC_Config always being ignored/overridden.

Instead this commit overrides the config default for 'interface' key with
DEFAULT_INTERFACE which can still be overridden with keys 'interface' or
'endpoint_type' in clouds.yaml or via the existing
--os-interface/OS_INTERFACE methods.

Ref.: https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/c500b637033cdf442231684079b041c9e37488fc

Task: 38955
Story: 2007380
Change-Id: Ia4e511c9d47201cca175711e1c4cfa596168202f

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN

When querying the status from HAProxy all values get read as
strings. Because the check wrongly assumed integer type values
it never detected the DRAIN status.

Story: 2009817
Task: 44389

Change-Id: If7d68c95173b8da66050659d1fb86225880dafdd

commit_message:
Add support for VMware First Class Disk (FCD)

An FCD, also known as an Improved Virtual Disk (IVD) or
Managed Virtual Disk, is a named virtual disk independent of
a virtual machine. Using FCDs for Cinder volumes eliminates
the need for shadow virtual machines.
This patch adds Kolla support.

Change-Id: Ic0b66269e6d32762e786c95cf6da78cb201d2765

commit_message:
Use unix socket while granting access for the backup service

/root/.my.cnf is not stored on galera container anymore, so it's not
possible to run mysql_user via TCP connection.
Unix socket should be used instead.

Change-Id: I71bc866aedaa6fba3cc86d2a2a99ed32f0727c54
(cherry picked from commit 3c57409bdfd0c48e08daf34c60ca401f0861eb56)

subject: Fix missing update of property_hash
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-18 13:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2022-02-20 09:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2022-02-21 09:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-18 13:14:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing update of property_hash

When a resource is created, the :ensure parameter should be set to
'present' so that exists returns true. In addition, the whole hash
should be cleared when a resource is deleted, otherwise subsequent
access might look up stale values. This change ensures property_hash is
updated in create/destroy accordingly.

This change also fixes the incorrect handling of "project" property
in nova_flavor which is causing unexpected update.

Finally, the ignored unit tests are fixed, to test the above fixes.

Change-Id: I611e3d0428674e7438fe15b276667f7b379d136e
(cherry picked from commit 60acc82c22d1edace44bffa8c1a9a6b23f739d25)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing update of property_hash

When a resource is created, the :ensure parameter should be set to
'present' so that exists returns true. In addition, the whole hash
should be cleared when a resource is deleted, otherwise subsequent
access might look up stale values. This change ensures property_hash is
updated in create/destroy accordingly.

This change also fixes the incorrect handling of "project" property
in nova_flavor which is causing unexpected update.

Finally, the ignored unit tests are fixed, to test the above fixes.

Change-Id: I611e3d0428674e7438fe15b276667f7b379d136e
(cherry picked from commit 60acc82c22d1edace44bffa8c1a9a6b23f739d25)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-18 17:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f
Closes-Bug: #1961438
'}]
commit_message:
Configure node-exporter to report correct file system metrics

Without this configuration, all mount points are reporting the same
utilisation metrics [1]. With the rslave option, all root mounts from
the host are visible in the container, so we can remove the bind mounts
for /proc and /sys.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#docker

Change-Id: I4087dc81f9d1fa5daa24b9df6daf1f9e1ccd702f
Closes-Bug: #1961438

commit_message:
Disable unwanted repositories from the zuul configure-mirrors role

These cause failures in real-world deployments as the host config
ends up being different from CI and it's possible we merge code that
is broken for non-CI cases.

See https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/configure-mirrors/tasks/mirror/CentOS-8.yaml

Change-Id: Ib7f85dedb62dbd30a493277995ed57c394045bee

[{'created': '2022-02-16 13:26:35.000000000', 'message': "Use correct relation key for allocation defaults

The nova-cloud-controller charm passes allocation ratio defaults
in the format '{cpu,disk,ram}_allocation_ratio' on the cloud-compute
relation.

Ensure that later OpenStack releases (>= Stein) query using this
key rather than one prefixed with 'initial_' which is used for the
target Nova Compute configuration option.

Closes-Bug: 1961065
Change-Id: I7d3e7f9f5c69f7ad06191a20bdfcfd6b5dca50d3
"}]
commit_message:
Use correct relation key for allocation defaults

The nova-cloud-controller charm passes allocation ratio defaults
in the format '{cpu,disk,ram}_allocation_ratio' on the cloud-compute
relation.

Ensure that later OpenStack releases (>= Stein) query using this
key rather than one prefixed with 'initial_' which is used for the
target Nova Compute configuration option.

Closes-Bug: 1961065
Change-Id: I7d3e7f9f5c69f7ad06191a20bdfcfd6b5dca50d3

I am quite certain, the patch does not cause the gate failing, it did before and it really hard to debug. From the linked issue, this should already be fixed. I have seen the gate job failing since end of February, but couldn't figure out yet why this happens. I'm willing to skip these checks.

However, especially this change should affect the integration test. It would be absolutely awesome, if you could add a test to the change so that this is not getting broken by a different change without a notice.
That is the reason for me to +1 this patch here."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-04-28 13:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29422, 'date': '2021-04-28 15:16:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hi Matthias,

Thank you for looking into this, I was struggling myself trying to understand how all this ecosytem works (Gnocchi - Ceilometer - Aodh) when I saw your work. It helped me a lot to understand the current situation 😊

So I tested your patch but it didn't work out of the box (Bullseye + Victoria)...

1. in [GnocchiAggregationResourcesThresholdEvaluator] _statistics - aodh/evaluator/gnocchi.py
The cpu_operation doesn't work for us, it is the way around : (aggregate rate:mean (metric cpu mean))

2. Sometimes I do have negative values returned which trigger alarms

3. evaluate_rule fails in /aodh/evaluator/threshold.py in case of evaluation_periods > 1 defined in my alarm. I had hack it to test and it passes this way:

if alarm_rule['metric'] == 'cpu':
          sufficient = len(statistics) >= 1
        else:
          sufficient = len(statistics) >= alarm_rule['evaluation_periods']

I don't know if it is possible but, wouldn't it be simpler and more understandbale for end users to document how to compute the cpu_util metric instead and expose this metric to users so they can use it in their alarms ? kind of like... before... 😄"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-04-29 15:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

Thank you for your work here!

Tbh, I am not sure if I like the extra role/handling for this single metric here, especially it does not help with any other metrics collected the same way. One could think of bringing up another network interface if there are faults or if the utilization goes over ... %

Ceilometer deprecated and removed transformers e.g to calculate cpu_util a couple of releases ago. The idea was to let gnocchi calculate this. 

I see two steps here: Get gnocchi do the necessary operation calculated documented and second get aodh work with theses aggregations. If there is an issue here in aodh re. that, it needs to be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2022-02-21 10:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandoned in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/829870'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2022-02-21 09:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2022-02-21 09:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nabandon in favor of  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-ovn/+/830126'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-21 09:53:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure subports status is aligned with parent port

Subports of a trunk should have the same status as the parent port.
However, with ovn, if the parent port is in DOWN status, the subports
are transitioned to ACTIVE as soon as they are attached to the trunk.

This patch ensure the status set on the subports when being attached
matches the one on the parent port.

From neutron master:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/824378

Closes-Bug: #1957161
Change-Id: I26c43c2909b635e8b21306ea1880da3877477a17
(manually cherry picked from commit 15d6cfffc9f3c63a7bac75f8d04beaae82ddc794)

Change-Id: I56e5f1fc53927143e26c90079f3e7e6e3b8dc5c9
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure subports status is aligned with parent port

Subports of a trunk should have the same status as the parent port.
However, with ovn, if the parent port is in DOWN status, the subports
are transitioned to ACTIVE as soon as they are attached to the trunk.

This patch ensure the status set on the subports when being attached
matches the one on the parent port.

From neutron master:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/824378

Closes-Bug: #1957161
Change-Id: I26c43c2909b635e8b21306ea1880da3877477a17
(manually cherry picked from commit 15d6cfffc9f3c63a7bac75f8d04beaae82ddc794)

Change-Id: I56e5f1fc53927143e26c90079f3e7e6e3b8dc5c9

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.
